loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: La joven Maria , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijos , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ella labora actualmente en una casa privada , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no cuenta con muchos recursos económicos para realizar de una sola vez la compra de materiales de construcción , ella se siente muy agradece por el apoyo y confianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva ya que con el primer préstamo compro zinc para que ya no se le siguiera pasando el agua , ahora con este va a comprar bloque, arena , hierro para realizar una pared de concreto en su casa de habitación .
texts.en: María resides in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband and small children.  Her plan for the family is to improve living conditions.  She currently works in a private home.  The greatest difficulty she faces is not having enough economic resources available to buy all the building materials and supplies at once.  She is grateful for the support and for the trust Afodenic places in her through the Kiva fund because she used her first loan to buy metal sheeting so that water wouldn’t keep leaking in.  Now, she’ll use this loan to buy concrete blocks, sand and iron rods to finish building a concrete wall in her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: El señor José, es habitante del municipio  de  Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa e hijo , la esposa actualmente labora como comerciante para apoyar  con algunos gastos de la casa , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida  y apoyar siempre en su estudios a su hijo para que logre llegar a la universidad , don José desde hace va ríos años labora en una empresa privada como guarda de seguridad , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuenta con un salario moderado que le permita comprar de una sola vez materiales de construcción , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic  atrávez de los fondo Kiva ya que sin ellos , él no lograría mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: José lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his wife and son.  His wife currently works as a merchant to help with some of the household expenses.  His plan for the family is to improve living conditions and to always support his son’s education so that he makes it to the university.  José has been working in a private firm as a security guard for several years now.  His greatest difficulty at present is that he does not earn a high enough salary that will make it possible for him to purchase all the building materials at the same time.  He is grateful for the support Afodenic provides him through the Kiva fund because without it he would not reach his goal of improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Emerson

texts.es: Emerson es natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero. Reside en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su propia casa construida a base de adobe y techo de calamina. Él es albañil, sus padres le enseñaron este oficio desde muy niño, y con la experiencia adquirida se convirtió en albañil, ahora realiza obres de construcción donde cimienta viviendas, puentes, escuelas y alcantarillas. Es muy reconocido por lo trabajos que realiza, pues trabaja con maestros, operarios, oficiales y peones cada quien dividido por sus propios rangos. Se siente muy a gusto con su labor porque cada vez va adquiriendo experiencias nuevas por estar en contacto con los ingenieros civiles. Asimismmo nos comenta que su trabajo le es muy rentable e incluso cobra por adelantado por sus servicios prestados, pero esta vez le falta dinero para refaccionar las fachadas de su vivienda es por ello que acude a MFP para facilitarle el crédito. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir creciendo y obteniendo buenos ingresos y así adquirir muchos bienes. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que éste crédito le ayudará mucho con el propósito de su trabajo. Los 1,000 soles que solicita, le servirá para comprar materiales de construcción y así refaccionar la fachada de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Emerson is from the city of Santa Rosa.  He’s 21 years old and single.  He lives in the beautiful Ayacucho jungle where he has his own house made from adobe; it has a plywood roof.  He’s a bricklayer; his parents taught him this occupation when he was still a boy.  He’s become a bricklayer with all the experience he’s gained and now works on construction projects where he builds foundations for homes, bridges, schools and drainage systems.  He is very well known for the work he does because he works with master builders, employees, officials and day laborers each divided up according to rank.  He feels very comfortable because he learns new experiences every time by being in contact with civil engineers.  He also comments that his work is very profitable and sometimes even is paid in advance for services rendered but on this occasion he’s lacking sufficient money to repair his house’s facades and this is why he’s calling on MFP to request a loan.  The plans he has are to continue growing and obtaining better income to acquire more assets.

This will be his third MFP loan.  He knows the loan will be very helpful for his work’s goals.  He will use the 1000 new soles to buy building materials and supplies to repair the facade of his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies for his house.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: El señor Alexander, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, don Alexander desde hace varios años se dedica al comercio (venta de ropa interior) al inicio fue comprando poco a poco y con el financiamiento que le otorgo Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva don Alexander a logrado incrementar su inventario y ventas ya que se siente muy contento  por el apoyo brindado , ahora  con este nuevo ciclo va a compra ropa para damas y caballeros para ofrecerle a sus clientes diversos productos y a la vez mejorar su ventas .
texts.en: Alexander lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his wife and small son.  His plan for his family is to improve its living conditions.  Alexander has been a merchant for several years (underwear sales).  At the beginning he’d buy just a little and gradually, with financing from Afodenic through the Kiva fund, Alexander has succeeded in increasing his inventory and his sales.  He feels very happy for the support provided.  Now, in this new cycle he’ll buy clothes for women and men to have a variety of products available for his customers and at the same time increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes for women and men.

loans.name: Octovianus

texts.en:
Octovianus is 45 years old, married and has three children: Marlensi, 22, is attending university; Rumly, 21, is working; Ivantri, 16, is in the first grade of technical high school.
Octovianus is a vegetable farmer. He has been working as a farmer for years. He is cultivating “Kangkung” vegetable, which he sells to his regular customers and is consumed by his family. Octovianus usually harvests the crop after 30 days. 
Currently, Octovianus plans to try another business – that is, raising pigs. He is thinking that the business is a good opportunity for him to generate more income in the future. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000. Octovianus will spend the loan on piglets to be raised and on fodder. He is hoping that his loan application will be approved by TLM.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and fodder.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 42 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 22,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store. She has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for six years and also earns an income from offering manicure and pedicure services.
Marites aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 60 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 
Nelia has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase more goods such as soap, detergent, grains, soft drinks, etc. to sell
Nelia has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her grandchildren to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as soap, detergent, grains, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 58 years old and widowed. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Leonora runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 19,500 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.
Leonora has borrowed and paid back 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and corn.
Leonora aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Teresita works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling scrap iron and empty bottles in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from running a general store. 
Teresita is borrowing 12,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more scrap and other recycled materials.
Teresita has been sustaining her business activities with her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap and other recycled materials.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lilia works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from buying and selling pigs. Lilia is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell for her business.
Lilia has been sustaining her business activities with her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 46 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.
Winnie runs a variety store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy more items to sell in her variety store. Winnie has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other miscellaneous items. 
Winnie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 58 years old and widowed with five children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing 17,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.
Lolita has been farming vegetables for nine years and also earns additional income from livestock and selling ready-to-wear clothing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 49 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family.
Lourdes runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.
Lourdes has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 
Andresa has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her food stall. She has been in this business for ten years.
In the future, Andresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 47 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. 
Luisa is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables and fruits.
Luisa is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
Felma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 23,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more charcoal to sell. Felma has been in this business for 18 years. She also earns income from coconut vending.
Felma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Melma

texts.en:
Melma is 45 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. Melma runs a pig raising business in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy additional piglets and feed for her business.
Melma has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for 11 years and also earns an income as an Avon dealer.
Melma aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 54 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by raising cows in the Philippines. 
Florentina is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her cows. She has been raising cows for ten years and also earns additional income from food vending and motorcycle transport. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her cows.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy additional ingredients for making bread for her bakery. Rosana has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from a sari-sari store.
Rosana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 55 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Nilda works very hard to provide for her family.
Nilda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, grains and other groceries. 
Nilda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials: manioc, corn, condiments, oil, cabbage, sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 
Anabelle has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice and charcoal.
In the future, Anabelle would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 67 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.
Concepcion runs a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. She has been in this business for 33 years and sells a variety of items such as sandals, shorts, pants, t-shirts, etc. 
In the future, Concepcion would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 60 years old, married and has five children. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.
Elizabeth has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.
In the future, Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 55 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by farming sugar cane in the Philippines. 
Estrella is borrowing 25,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has been farming sugar cane for seven  years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.
Estrella is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 58 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Letecia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 23,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store. She has borrowed and paid back 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.
Letecia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his truck.

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a desktop publishing and photography business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase additional materials and equipment for her business.
Macaria has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from food vending. Macaria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.
Margarita has been in this business for 33 years. She earns additional income from raising livestock. Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 60 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.
Mercedes has borrowed and paid back 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for 14 years and also earns an income from raising chickens.
Mercedes aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 59 years old and widowed with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.
Ofelia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as rice. 
In the future, Ofelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business. Flordeliza has been in this business for 11 years. She earns additional income from farming sugar cane.
Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rosadel

texts.en:
Rosadel is 64 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Rosadel runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy additional items to sell. She has borrowed and paid back nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for nine years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading.
Rosadel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Meldrina

texts.en:
Meldrina is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 
Meldrina has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for seven years now.
In the future, Meldrina would like to save money to expand her business and repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 39 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Celia is borrowing 12,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. Celia has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 56 years old and widowed with four children. She earns a living by farming sugar cane in the Philippines. 
Elizabeth is borrowing 16,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to pay for the laborers' salaries for her sugar cane field. Elizabeth has been farming sugar cane for 23 years and also earns additional income from tailoring.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the laborers' salaries on her sugar cane field.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 54 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Emily runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell. Emily has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her rice retailing business for eight years and also earns an income from a general store.
Emily aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 48 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by running a general store in the Philippines. 
Emma is borrowing 15,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from rice retailing, buying and selling charcoal and water distribution.
Emma is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a buying and selling of herbal medicine business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of herbal medicine to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of herbal medicine to sell.

loans.name: Junalie

texts.en:
Junalie is 41 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 9 years.

Junalie requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buying and selling of bananas and spices business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years now.

Lilia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas and spices to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and spices to sell.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Loida works hard to support her family. She is a dealer in a mineral water business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from the buying and selling of charcoal. Loida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional water containers for her mineral water dealership.

Loida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional water containers for her business.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail gasoline business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gasoline to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her retail gasoline business for a year and also earns an income from entertainment (videoke).

Luzminda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Milagrosa

texts.en:
Ma. Milagrosa is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She earns a living through pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been fattening pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Ma. Milagrosa is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional pigs, feeds and vitamins. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional pigs, feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Resalie

texts.en:
Resalie is 44 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She is a dealer of herbal medicines in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of herbal medicines.

She has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the herbal medicines business for 5 years and also earns an income from selling ready to wear. Resalie aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of herbal medicine.

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh was born in 1971. She lives in Ngoc Loi village, Duc Tu commune. She is married. She has two children. Her husband is a worker and has an income. 

Khanh is a farmer. She not only grows rice but she also sells pork in the market. She has had this job for three years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

Since 2006 she has participated in SEDA and always pays her loans punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,066,000 VND to buy more pork to resell.

loans.use: to buy more pork to resell.

loans.name: Saddam

texts.es:
Saddam cuenta con 22 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo pequeño de un año de edad llamado Cristo Ángel su esposa se llama Martha ella se dedica al comercio tiene un puesto en la cooperativa de la escuela.

El se dedica al servicio urbano de camionetas tiene una camioneta pasajera el invirtió en darle mantenimiento a la camioneta en el negocio de su esposa ya que de ambos negocios van sacando para compartir los gastos.

Ha Saddam le gustaría poner otra camioneta y hacer crecer un poco más el negocio de su esposa.
texts.en:
Saddam, 22, is married and has a little one-year-old son called Cristo Ángel; his wife’s name is Martha and she’s a merchant.  She has a stand at the school coop.

He provides urban bus transportation services.  He has a passenger van.  He used the loan to service his wife’s business’ van because they depend on both businesses to share expenses.  Saddam would like to put a second van into service and to make his wife’s business grow a bit more.

loans.use: to repair his wife's business' vehicle.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe cuenta con 25 años de edad es casada tiene 2 hijas una se llama Maireth se encuentra estudiando 2º grado de primaria mientras que la mas chica solo cuanta con 2 años de edad su esposo se llama Héctor el cual se dedica al campo.

Ella se dedica al comercio a la venta de pescado y verduras como son: chile, jitomate, y ejote y frijoles ella sale a vende a los pueblos vecinos lo cual invirtió su préstamo en la compra de verdura y pescado.

A la Sra. Guadalupe  le gustaría que su negocio incrementara más ya que pues le da ganancias y lo cual le ayuda en los gastos en la casa.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 25, is married and has two daughters.  One of them is called Maireth and is in second grade and the youngest is only two years old.  Her husband’s name is Héctor and he works in the fields.

She is a merchant.  She sells fish and vegetables like chilies, tomatoes, green beans and beans.  She goes out to neighboring towns to sell and used her loan to buy vegetables and fish.

Guadalupe would like her business to grow more because it produces profits that help her cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fish, chilies, tomatoes, green beans and beans.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa cuenta con 47 años de edad es casada tiene 1  hijo que depende de ella el cual estudia la secundaria su esposo se llama Filiberto el cual se dedica al campo.

Rosa se dedica al comercio vende pollos el cual surtió su granja comprando cajas de pollos, ella dice que la beneficio mucho ya que surtió su negocio y tuvo más ganancias.

A ella le gustaría que su negocio incrementara aun más ya que le gustaría establecer una granja más grande.
texts.en:
Rosa is 47 years old, married and has a dependent son going to secondary school.  Her husband’s name is Filiberto and he works in the fields.

Rosa is a chicken merchant.  She stocked her farm buying crates of chickens.  She says that this benefitted her much because she stocked her business and earned higher profits.

She’d like her business to grow still more because she’d like to have a larger farm.

loans.use: to buy crates of chickens.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina cuenta con 30 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos que estudian la mayor estudia 2º grado de primaria y yaritza estudia 2º grado del preescolar su esposo se llama Enoc se dedica al campo.

Ella es comerciante tiene un pequeño negocio de abarrotes y un molino ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de productos como son: aceite, galleta, leche, frijol, papel higiénico, ella dice que le ha ayudado mucho económicamente.   Angelina le gustaría que su negocio creciera un poco más.
texts.en:
Angelina, 30, is married and has two children.  The older one is in second grade and Yaritza is in second year of preschool.  Her husband’s name is Enoc and he works in the fields.

She’s a merchant.  She has a small grocery store and mill.  She used the loan to buy products like: oil, cookies, milk, beans and toilet paper.  She says that it’s been of great economic help to her.  Angelina would like her business to grow a bit more.

loans.use: to buy oil, cookies, milk, beans, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Jose Arturo

texts.es:
José Arturo cuenta con 24 años de edad es casado tiene un pequeño hijo de un año su esposa es trabajadora social.

El es comerciante de ganado lo cual invirtió su préstamo en la compra de marranos para matanza el vende la carne en el pueblo y uno que otro ganado que sale para vender, dice que le beneficio ya que le ayudo a producir más animales.

Ha José Arturo le gustaría que su negocio incrementara un poco mas ya que le gustaría agrandar su granja.
texts.en:
José Arturo is 24 years old, married and has a little one-year-old son; his wife’s a social worker.

He’s a livestock merchant.  He invested his loan in the purchase of pigs to butcher and sell the meat in town and in the purchase of a few head of cattle to sell.  He says that it befitted him in that it helped him produce more animals.

José Arturo would like his business to grow a bit more since that would help his farm to be larger.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is 57 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Rosela has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retailing business for 3 years and also earns an income from her sari-sari (general) store.

Rosela aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo cuenta con 31 años de edad es  separado tiene hijos pero no están con él.
El es chofer de su propio servicio urbano es transportista tiene una camioneta pasajera la cual trabaja el mismo, el invirtió su préstamo en mantenimiento del carro el ahora dice estar contento ya que ha sabido salir adelante a Gustavo le gustaría poner otra camioneta ya que pues en el pueblo no hay mucho transporte y a él le gustaría meter otra camioneta a trabajar.
texts.en: Gustavo is 31 years old and separated.  He has children but they do not live with him.  He’s a driver of his own vehicle.  He has a passenger van that provides urban transportation services that he drives himself.  He used the loan to service the vehicle.  He says that he’s happy now because he’s known how to get ahead.  Gustavo would like to put a second van into operation because there isn’t much transportation available in his town and he’d like to put another van to work.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Elizabeth cuenta con 54 años de edad, ella es viuda tienes hijos los cuales ya son independiente de ellos mismos, ella se dedica al comercio tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual no tiene nombre pero dice que está pensando poner uno.

Ella invertirá su préstamo en la compra de productos como son: refrescos, aceites, leche, huevo, frutas, verduras, etc. 
La Sra. Elizabeth espera que su crédito le traiga beneficios ya que a ella le gustaría que su negocio incrementara un poco mas meter otros productos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 54, is a widow.  She has children who are already independent and living on their own.  She’s a merchant; she has a grocery store that has no name but she’s thinking about naming it.  

She will use her loan to buy products like soft-drinks, oil, milk, eggs, fruit, vegetables, etc.  Elizabeth hopes the loan will bring her benefits since she’d like her business to grow a bit more and to add other products to her inventory.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, milk, oil, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 57 years old and a widow with 7 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail gasoline business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Tessie has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the gasoline business for 7 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Tessie aspires to save enough money so she can provide a secure future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor cuenta con 32 años de edad es casada tiene 3 hijos lo cuales se encuentra estudiando el mayor se llama Román tiene 9 años esta estudiado 3º grado de primaria y Guadalupe de 7 años está estudiando 2º grado de primaria y Jacqueline esta en 1º grado de primaria, su esposo se llama Román es campesino.

Ella se dedica al comercio y docente de primaria ella vende los domingos tamales y pozoles varea a veces pozole o tamales también vende pollos y pescado su préstamo lo invirtió en la compra de cajas de pollos y pescado.

Ha Leonor le gustaría que su negocio creciera un poco mas ya que quisiera establecer un local de comida.
texts.en:
Leonor is 32 years old, married and has three children going to school.  The oldest is called Román.  He’s 9 years old and going to third grade.  Guadalupe, 7, is going to second grade and Jacqueline is in first grade.  Her husband’s name is Román and he’s a field worker.

She’s a merchant and an elementary school teacher.  She sells tamales and/or pozole on Sundays; sometimes it’s tamales and sometimes it’s pozole.  She also sells chickens and fish.  She used her loan to buy crates of chickens and to buy fish.  Leonor would like her business to grow a bit more because she’d like to set up a food stand.

loans.use: to buy crates of chickens and to buy fish.

loans.name: Procopia

texts.es:
Procopia cuenta con 56 años de edad ella ahora se encuentra separada de su esposo tiene un hijo el cual ya no estudia.

Ella se dedica al comercio tiene una tienda de abarrotes y maíz por litros lo cual invirtió su préstamo en 3 sacos de azúcar, 5 bolsas de maíz, frijol y refrescos. 
Doña Procopia dice que su préstamo el beneficio en poder surtir su negocio y sacar para poder tener para el gasto, a ella le gustaría ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Procopia is 56 years old and is now separated from her husband. She has a child who no longer studies. 

She has a grocery store and sells corn by volume. The purpose of her loan is to buy 3 bags of sugar, 5 bags of corn, beans, and soft drinks. 

Porcopia says the loan benefits her because she can supply her business and use the income for her expenses. She would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of sugar, 5 bags of corn, beans, and soft drinks for her grocery store

loans.name: Rodolfa

texts.es:
Rodolfa cuenta con 52 años es viuda tienes dos hijos que depende de ella ya no estudian le ayudan económicamente.

Ella dedica al comercio vende pescado y queso lo cual invirtió su préstamo en la compra de pescado y mas queso, ella sale a vender su pescado y queso en el pueblo y al pueblo vecino.

Rodolfa dice que su préstamo le ayudado mucho ya que con la inversión de su préstamo se encuentra trabajando, ha ella  que le gustaría que incrementara un poco más.
texts.en:
Rodolfa is 52, a widow, and she has two dependent children who are no longer in school and who help her with expenses.

She sells fish and cheese and will use the loan to buy fish and more cheese.  She sells these in her town and in the neighboring one.

Rodolfa says that her loan has helped her a lot to keep her working.  
She would like  to expand her business a little more.

loans.use: to buy fish and more fish for when she goes out to sell these items

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica cuenta con 34 años de edad es casada tiene 5 hijos los cuales estudian diana estudia 2º grado de bachiller, Narcisa estudia 3º de secundaria, Tania estudia 3º de primaria y Yoselin estudia 1º grado de preescolar mientras que el más pequeño solo tiene 8 meses, su esposo se llama lauro se dedica al campo.

Ella se dedica al comercio tiene un pequeño negocio de abarrotes lo cual invirtió su préstamo en surtir en la compra de productos como son: aceite, galletas, papel higiénico, refrescos, jugos, etc.

A verónica le gustaría que su negocio creciera un poco mas ya quiere establecer un local para allí poner su abarrote.
texts.en:
Verónica is 34, married, and has five children. Of the ones who are in school, Diana is in second year of senior high school, Narcisa is in third year of secondary school, Tania is in third year of primary school, Yoselin is in first grade of pre-school, while the youngest is only eight months old. Her husband Lauro is a farmer.

She has a small grocery store business, and has used her loan to buy products for stocking her store, such as cooking oil, cookies, toilet paper, soft drinks, juices, etc. 

Veronica would like her business to grow a bit more, and wants to set up a shop for selling her groceries.

loans.use: To buy products for stocking her store, such as cooking oil, cookies, toilet paper, soft drinks, juices etc.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.es:
Crisanta cuenta 57 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos los cuales están estudiando Dulce María está iniciando su primer año en medicina ya que logro quedarse en el politécnico de México y Eduardo está cursando el primer grado de bachiller su esposo se llama René él se dedica a la ganadería.

Ella y su esposo son comerciante vende pescado y  ganado venden vacas, chivos, marranos compran y crían para después vender o también matan los animales y vende la carne en el pueblo, ella dice que el préstamo le ayudo mucho económicamente ya que invirtió  en compra de marranos y chivos y ha estado sacando ganancias y así aportando para los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos. A doña crisanta le gustaría hacer más grande la granja.
texts.en:
Crisanta is 57 years old, married and has 2 children who are studying. Dulce Maria is beginning her first year in medicine at the polytechnic school in Mexico and Eduardo is in his first year of high school. Her husband is named Rene. He works in the field of livestock.

Crisanta and her husband have a business selling fish and livestock. They sell cows, goats, and pigs. They buy and raise them in order to later sell or they slaughter them to sell the meat in town. She says that the loan will be a big help financially as they have invested in the purchase of pigs and goats and have been using the profits to pay the educational expenses of their children. Crisanta would like to increase the size of the farm.

loans.use: to buy pigs and goats

loans.name: Teratai Indah 2 Group

texts.en:
Yulianti is 37 years old. She is married with two sons who are 15 and 7 years old. Since 2009, she has been selling clothing on credit from her house and going around the neighborhood from door to door. The business is doing well despite increased competition recently in her neighborhood from other clothing sellers.  
With this loan, she wants to expand her inventory and buy more clothes to resell. The income from her business is used to pay school fees, buy uniforms for her children and also build her savings. She hopes that someday she will have enough savings to open a clothing kiosk. Her hopes for her family are that both of her sons will be able to attend college and the family will be able to afford it.
The women in this group are all cousins. The other women are using their loans for businesses such as reselling clothing on credit, buying inventory for their general store, and selling nasi uduk (an Indonesian rice dish).

loans.use: to pay for clothing to resell on credit.

loans.name: Bungur Indah Group

texts.en:
Layla is 32 years old and married with two children.  She has been buying Mr. Cool packets and making them into ice cream to resell to stores and neighbors since 2007.  The business is going well, with increased demand, and she needs the loan to be able to go to the distributor and buy a greater amount of Mr. Cool packets.  She will use the loan to increase volume and hopefully expand to Sumatra Island.  Her husband helps her with her business by driving her to the distributor and stores that she sells the ice cream to.

Her future plan is that she wants to be able to send her children to school and continually expand her business.  By helping make her business more profitable, she can continue to help the economic position of her family.

Some of the other group members will use their loans to sell fried snack foods, drinks from kiosks, and sell shoes.

loans.use: to pay for more Mr. Cool packets to make into ice cream and resell to stores.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon, a married woman who has operated a fish-vending business in the Philippines for 14 years, works hard to support her family. Now requesting  a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell, Corazon would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Talaigul's Group

texts.en:
Talaigul is the leader of this group. She is 29 and unfortunately she is a widow. She is bringing up two daughters. The older daughter studies at school and the second is not in school yet as she is preschool age (under seven). 

This year, with an initial investment of 40,000 soms, Talaigul started to breed farm animals. In this way she earns money to meet the family's needs. Her monthly income is about 3,000 soms. With money received from the loan, Talagul plans to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and future reselling. In the future she wants to provide her daughters with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang was born in 1963. She lives in Ngoc Loi village with her husband and three children. Her husband is a carpenter. He has been working at his workshop with Sang's help. They have had this business for three years. They have a monthly income of about 7,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

Since 2006 Seda has participated in SEDA. The last time she borrowed 7,194,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,066,000 VND to buy wood to produce furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood to produce furniture.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a divorced woman with two school-going children. She has a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.  

She has operated as a vegetable vendor for the past five years. Her potential clients are passersby. She faces a major challenge of the lack of enough capital to expand her business. She dreams of having a grocery in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a sack of potatoes, tomatoes and a sack of charcoal. She decided to join Yehu because it offers loan facilities to low income earners.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of potatoes, tomatoes and a sack of charcoal.

loans.name: Janyl's Group

texts.en:
Janyl is the leader of this group. She is 66, and together with her husband, who is a retiree, she has raised two sons. The older son lives separately with his family, and under the Kyrgyz traditions the younger son lives with the parents to take care of them.

The family is engaged in farming, and they have been cultivating agricultural products since 1992. With money received from the loan, Janyl wants to purchase fuel for collecting the harvest. In the future, with the profits gained from selling the harvest, she plans to improve their living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for collecting the harvest.

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years now.

Genie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save money to buy more cooking utensils.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar lives happily with his family. He is 46 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. His wife is a housekeeper. Oscar is a farmer, planting corn in the Philippines. To quickly provide their daily needs and pay the school fees for his children, Oscar and his wife engage themselves in planting and harvesting various types of vegetables in some part of their field, and sell in the public market to gain profit.
   
Oscar also engages in a hog raising business. With the profit earned from his farming business, he can provide his hogs with feed. Due to a typhoon encountered by the farmers, his crops were destroyed. Now, Oscar is requesting a loan of P20,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a married woman. For the last two years, she has been selling mobile phone airtime cards to earn a living. Previously, she operated a retail shop. In the next 5 years, she wants to become successful in her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy mobile phone airtime cards for resale.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone airtime cards.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children who attend school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. Fatuma owns a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a leso (kanga) selling business for the past three months. Her potential clients are her neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of high prices of lesos which have reduced her profit. She dreams of having a one stop shop for all varieties of the traditional lesos. (Lesos, or kanga, are traditional Kenyan women's clothing. See picture above.)

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more lesos and rent a business premises. She decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase more lesos and rent a business premises.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy handkerchiefs, toys and padlocks.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
Salvador is 59 years old and married with five children. He manages an agricultural business which is planting corn as well as a hog raising business. His wife is his partner in managing their businesses.

Salvador’s hog raising business operation is not steady because of the lack of finances. He only operates this hog raising business if he gets high yields from his crops and gains a higher income. Because of the typhoon occurrence, his income from the crop business was low. This decided Salvador to borrow a loan of P29,000 to buy piglets to raise and also feed for their maintenance.
 
He hopes to manage this business well so it will become one of his stable sources of income. The loan will be a big help for him to continue operating his hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and also feed for their maintenance.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a focused businessman aged 45. He is married and blessed with six children. He has been welding to make a living. He is also employed. He has managed to improve his business with the business management skills he gained from the training conducted by Faulu Kenya.  In the next five years, he wants to manage a wholesale business. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a welding machine for his business.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Silwa

texts.en:
Silwa is a 44-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child. She has owned a mini-market since 1984. She sells in her grocery store different types of dairy and daily products in addition to other merchandise such as toffees, soft drinks, etc. With her business income, she is able to help her husband pay the heavy life expenses. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added merchandise so that she can always meet the demand of her customers. She is very optimistic about her future plans and wishes to further expand her business operation.

loans.use: to purchase added merchandise.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a hardworking businesswoman aged 25. She is married and blessed with two children.  For the last four years, she has been selling clothes to earn a living. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy dresses, sweaters and blouses for resale.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, dresses and blouses.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 51 years old and widowed with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Josefa has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 12 years and also earns an income from rice retailing and selling medicine.

Josefa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en: Magdaline is a single woman and blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. For the last four years, she has been tailoring to earn a living. She has improved her business since she joined Faulu Kenya, thanks to Faulu Kenya's training her in business management skills.  In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy thread, fabric and coat hangers for her business.

loans.use: To buy thread, fabric and coat hangers.

loans.name: Assia

texts.en:
Assia is a married woman with three children who are still attending school. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the past seven years; her potential clients are the residents of Kwale. She faces a major challenge of seasonality: there is no fish in the cold season. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase fish for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it’s friendly and flexible to clients needs.

loans.use: To purchase fish for her business.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 26-year-old Lebanese man living with one parent and two siblings and engaged to be married. He has owned a Hubble-bubble (water pipe) shop since 2005. With his requested loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to improve his shop and purchase additional products needed. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits at least by 5%. In the future, he plans to expand his business into other areas.

loans.use: to improve his shop and purchase additional products needed.

loans.name: Hamzah

texts.en:
Hamzah is a 26-year-old married man from Lebanon living with his wife. He has owned a football playground in his village since 2009. He welcomes customers of different ages who are looking for a place where they can enjoy playing football then rest and benefit from delicious snacks and refreshing drinks. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to improve the condition of the playground and purchase more merchandise such as sweets, crackers etc. to allow customers play safely and enjoy their time while relaxing.

loans.use: to improve the condition of his playground  and purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Nimwenga

texts.en:
Nimwenga is a married woman with five children, two of whom attend school while the others are grown-ups. She owns a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She has operated a poultry-selling business for the past seven years; her potential clients are her neighbors, friends and café owners. She faces a major challenge of poultry diseases that sometimes kill all the chicks. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane used her previous loan to buy clothes. With the additional stock, she was able to make more profit from her business.  She has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to expand her business premises and add to her stock of clothes.

Jane was blessed with a baby four months ago.

loans.use: To buy clothing and utensils to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a focused businesswoman aged 28. She is married and blessed with four children. For the last two years, she has been operating a mobile-phone money transfer business and also sells phone accessories to make a living. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy phone accessories for resale.

loans.use: To buy phone accessories.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a divorced woman with six children who are all grown up. She owns a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She has worked as a porridge and cassava crisps seller for the past thirty years; her potential clients are Kinarini residents, neighbors, family and friends. She faces a major challenge of lack of funds to expand her business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase cassava and porridge flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it is easy to access loans.

loans.use: To purchase cassava and porridge flour for her business.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a 41-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and three young children who are still attending school. She has been running a clothing store since 2009. She only sells women's and children's clothes but she also sells sportswear, socks, flannel shirts, etc. Her business income is vital for her family; she helps her husband. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her store’s inventory of new winter clothes. She’s certain that the loan will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she is hoping to also sell men's clothes.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory of new winter clothes.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 45-year-old divorced man from Lebanon. He is living with one parent and three siblings. He opened a vegetable shop in 1990. In addition, he has prepared a corner where he sells fruit. Like the majority of the Lebanese men, he helps his family with the household expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added vegetables and fruit to sell. He will also use the loan to improve his shop’s decoration. In the future, he plans to open a juice shop.

loans.use: to purchase added vegetables and fruit to sell and improve his shop’s decoration.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with three children who are still attending school. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of basic family needs. She lives in a rental house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a cafe for the past seven years; her potential clients are Kwale residents. She faces a major challenge of competition from other café operators. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for cafe. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loans.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for her cafe.

loans.name: Georges

texts.en:
Georges is a 59-year-old widowed man from Lebanon living with his two children. In 1987, he opened a car repair shop. His job consists in painting and repainting the cars. He has one full-time employee helping him with the work. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new improved tools and supplies. In the future, he plans to enlarge his shop and start a car spare parts sales business.

loans.use: to purchase new improved tools and supplies.

loans.name: Anesia

texts.en:
Anesia is a 43-year-old married woman with four children. Anesia's husband works as a driver.

Anesia has been in the business of raising hogs for a year. She plans to use her loan to purchase piglets, feed and cement for piggery construction. Each month, Anesia earns 4000 PHP by doing the hog raising business.

Anesia hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and cement for piggery construction.

loans.name: Yehia

texts.en: Yehia is a 42-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two young children. He has been running his own bakery since 1998. He produces tasty Lebanese pastries and his products are enjoyed by members from his community. With his requested loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to renew his business tools. His bakery is an important source of income for his family. In the future, he plans to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to renew his business tools.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with seven children who are attending school. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of basic family needs. She owns a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has worked as a sweet potato and cassava seller at Kwale open air market for the past ten years; her potential clients are Kwale residents. She faces a major challenge of transportation cost of her products from the farm to the market. She dreams of putting up a decent stall and stocking it fully.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to add a variety of stock like arrowroots, Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes and cassava. She decided to join Yehu because it offers good services.

loans.use: To purchase arrowroots, Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes and cassava.

loans.name: Mwanamze

texts.en:
Mwanamze is a single woman with two children, both of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past four years, Mwanamze has operated a food sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of high transport costs in her business. She dreams of establishing a stall to sell food in the future.  
With this loan of 20,000 KES, Mwanamze wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and beans. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and bean.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her child.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of license fees for the business. She dreams of establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the KES 80,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Georges

texts.en:
Georges is a 27-year-old single man living with his cousin. 

He has owned a snack shop in his town since 2008. He prepares tasty sandwiches such as chicken and beef and he also makes pizza. He has one full-time employee helping him with the work. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new oven for pizza baking. He has a great demand for pizza and he plans to increase his business productivity in order to gain a superior income.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven for pizza baking.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 39 years old and married. She has three children.

Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Victoria has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 13 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Victoria aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Norain

texts.en:
Norain is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of banana to sell in her business.

Norain has been in this business for seven years, and she earns additional income from farming rice.

Norain has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is 52 years old and has been raising hogs for almost five years. She engaged herself in this business to generate income to provide a good education for her children. She has three children attending school. She usually earns about PHP 2,000 for each hog disposed. Profits go for her children's school fees and allowances.

Brigida has insufficient funds to sustain her hogs, so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, medicines and vitamins for the hogs. She wants to ensure good nutrition and proper growth of hogs.

She wants to continue growing as an entrepreneur and someday lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vitamins for the hogs.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for 18 years. Vilma earns additional income from farming coconut.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a hollow blocks-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her hollow blocks-making business.

Liezel has been in this business for a year. Liezel earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 70 years old and married. She has four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Salome is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Salome has been raising pigs for 35 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and running a sari-sari store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and married. She has six children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 27 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and retailing rice and feeds.

Josephine aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Isiah

texts.en:
Isiah is a married man with four children who go to school. His wife is a cook at a local school and she contributes to meeting the family's basic needs. Isiah lives in a house without electricity or running water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children.  For the past two years, Isiah has operated a business selling tree seedlings. His potential clients are local area residents. Isiah’s major business challenge is the lack of water for irrigation. He decided to join Yehu when he became aware of their services. 

Isiah is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase more seedlings to grow and sell. In the future, he dreams of buying another farm and expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase tree seedlings

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en:
Leizel is 26 years old and married with one child. For the past four years, she has earned a living by raising livestock in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Leizel is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock to raise

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 39 years old and married with eight children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 21 years, Jocelyn has been making and selling ice cream in the Philippines. 

Jocelyn is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her ice cream. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make and sell ice cream

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Delia works hard to support her family. She has a business selling beverages and purified drinking water in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from a general store. Delia has been sustaining her business activities through nine previous loans from NWTF.

Delia is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more cases of beverages and purified drinking water to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 41 years old and is married with three children. For the past six years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Janet has sustained her business with 11 previous loans from NWTF.

Janet is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca (plant fiber) weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and also earns an income from a sari-sari (variety) store. Lorelie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and the help of loans from NWTF

Lorelie is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy abaca weaving materials. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy abaca weaving materials

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with three children, all of whom have graduated from school. She lives in a rental house with electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expense is rent. For the past three years, Halima has operated a business selling coconuts from her home to neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is the high cost of purchasing food products. Halima decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Halima is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy three sacks of coconuts to sell. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts to sell

loans.name: Anaclita

texts.en:
Anaclita is 64 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past six years Anaclita has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from motorcycle rentals. She has borrowed and repaid 12 previous loans from NWTF.

Anaclita is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store. She aspires to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and works hard to support her family. For the past 16 years, she has operated a cheese-making business in the Philippines.

Gloria is requesting a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients to make and sell cheese. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make cheese

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 32 years old and is married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been running this business for the past 15 years.

Teresa is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat engine

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 58 years old, married, and has three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Alejandra is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Alejandra has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income by selling food. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en: Apolinaria, a 62-year-old single woman, has been raising pigs for six years in the Philippines and earns additional income from operating a sari-sari store. Now requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs, Apolinaria is  working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, a  34-year-old married mother of three children, two of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has been selling coconut wine  in the Philippines for 3 years. Marilyn has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more coconut wine to sell, and in  the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Hermima

texts.en: Hermima, a 60-year-old married mother of eight, works hard to provide for her family, running a sari-sari store for the past four years as well as growing rice and raising pigs.
