Having already borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF, Hermima is now requesting a PHP 29500 loan to buy more items to sell in her store. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is married and has seven children, six of whom attend school while one is not yet old enough to go. She owns a house that has electricity and piped-in water, and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past 15 years, she has made a living running a beauty salon. Most of her customers are neighbors and passersby. Susan also owns rental properties, which supplement the income she earns in her shop. Her major challenge is that the number of customers she serves varies by season. Her goal for the future is to open a hair-dressing school. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 80,000 to buy equipment such as a hair dryer, and recently joined Yehu as a way to access loans that will allow her to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Sibelle

texts.en: Sibelle is a 19-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and two siblings. She has owned a shoe shop for the past year. She always presents the new trends and collections to her customers to satisfy their demands. She is thankful for her business income; it allows her to improve her family’s financial status. Today, she is requesting a loan of $1000 from Ameen s.a.l., a Kiva partner, to purchase more shoes to sell. In the future, she plans to expand her business operation into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Baktigul's Group

texts.en:
Baktigul is the leader of this group. She is 45 and is raising four children: two daughters and two sons. Her husband works in Russia; each month he transfers money to meet the family's needs. The older daughter is married and lives separately with her family, the older son works in Russia, and the other children study at school. In order to earn money Baktigul cultivates agricultural products. She also takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national pillows and blankets. She earns an additional 3000 KGS for the family budget by doing the sewing work. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more fabrics and materials which are needed for sewing. In the near future Baktigul plans to gather the harvest; with the profits gained she will start house repairs.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a hardworking mother. She is 48 years old, married and has seven children. Four of her children attend school. Milagros manages her small sari-sari (variety) store. She sells daily-use products such as biscuits, soap, shampoo, and beverages to the people in her village. With the profits earned a month ago, she bought hogs to fatten so she could increase her income. 

She now has insufficient funds to buy items for her store. She is asking for a loan amount of 5,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, bread, eggs, and instant noodles to sell in her store. This would help improve her sales.

She would like to continuously provide a good education for all her children so they will have a brighter future someday.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bread, eggs, and instant noodles to sell in her store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a married and lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with her family. For the last four years, she has earned a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells items such as noodles, sugar, vinegar, canned goods and vegetables. She is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal is to expand the size of her store.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: Leonarda is 40 years old and lives in the town of Talibon with husband and three children. She is married to a fisherman and is responsible for operating their boat and selling her husband's catch in the town's market. They both work hard to improve their business and sustain their family. She is applying for this loan to buy fishing nets, hooks and other gear. Her goal is to expand their business and provide her children with a good life.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other gear.

loans.name: Rano's Group

texts.en:
Rano is the leader of this group. She is 40 years old and is married to a baker. Together with her husband, she raises four daughters and a son. Their oldest daughter is married, another daughter studies at school, and their son is just one year old. 

Twelve years ago, with an initial investment of 3500 soms, Rano’s husband rented a place for baking bread.  At the moment, Rano has applied for the loan because they need additional money to purchase more flour and coal for baking bread. In the future, she plans to improve the business. With the profits gained from the trade, Rano plans to celebrate her second daughter’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by MCC Mol Bulak Finance LLC (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase flour and coal.

loans.name: Qamar

texts.en:
Qamar is a 23-year-old young woman who is married with two daughters.  Her husband is a vehicle electrician and earns a low income.  Agriculture provides another source of income.  

Qamar wants to take a loan from Kiva partner FATEN to help her husband pay the fees for a training course in vehicle electrical systems.  The loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, will help Qamar’s husband enhance his skills so he can increase his income and provide better living conditions for the family.  Qamar is a conservative woman, so the photograph is of her husband Mashhour.

loans.use: to pay the fees for a training course in vehicle electrical systems for her husband to improve his business.

loans.name: 06.01.15 Đông Vệ Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Lan is 52 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa Province.  Lan is the leader of a 5-member group, named the 15 Đông Vệ Solidarity Group.  She operates a stall where she sells clothing, a business in which she has been involved for more than 10 years.  Lan’s main business hardship is a lack of capital.

In 2011, Lan joined Kiva partner Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing for resale.  Lan has successfully repaid two previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She hopes to build a house with her business profits.  Also, Lan hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for her resale business.

loans.name: 06.02.01 Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Ngân is 40 years old and she is married with two children.  She lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province.  Ngân is the leader of a 6-member group, called the 01 Đông Vệ Solidarity Group. She has a manufacturing business making incense and has been involved in this business for more than ten years.  The main business hardship she faces is a lack of capital.

In 2010, Ngân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.   She has successfully repaid two previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is requesting a new loan to purchase materials to make votive objects to sell.  Ngân hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make votive objects for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water.  Mary’s greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling firewood.  Mary runs her business from home, selling to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition, she operates a food stall for additional income.  Mary faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business as the demand for firewood is lower during the rainy season.  She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Mary wants to use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase bundles of firewood and food supplies for her food stall.  She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood to sell and food supplies for her food stall.

loans.name: 06.01.14 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Hà is 52 years old and she is married with two children.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa Province.  Hà is the group leader of the 14-Đông Vệ Solidarity Group, which consists of 3 members.  She has a retail business selling noodles and has been in this business for more than ten years.  The main business hardship she faces is a lack of capital.

In 2011, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.  Hà has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  In the future, Hà hopes for her business to do well, to buy a new motorbike, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell as part of her noodle retail business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 22 years old and the mother of a three-year-old son. She is raising him by herself because her husband abandoned his family a year ago because their life was so difficult. Today, Francis earns a living by raising hogs, and her main goal in life is to care for her son and provide for his future. She is applying for a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them to eat. In the future, she dreams of putting her son through school so that they can both live a better life.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them to eat.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is single, has no children and lives in a house that has electricity and piped-in water. His greatest monthly expense is food. He earns a living by supplying various residents in Kwale town with bread. His main challenges are having enough bread to sell and providing his customers with credit when they need it. Victor is applying for a loan for Kshs 20,000 to buy more bread to sell and more crates to store it in. He joined Yehu as a way to secure the funds he needs to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell and crates to store it in.

loans.name: Reyma

texts.en:
Reyma is 23 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store for almost three months. She is still single and a registered nurse in this country. During these months of operating her business, she has been in the process of healing from a car accident. Before that accident, she was just waiting her visa to fly to Canada and work as a nurse. 

But because of what happened, she is not be able to work anymore in Canada. This causes her to stay indoors and built her own sari-sari store. It was hurtful for her to be in an accident but she needs to accept it and continue the journey of life. 

Right now, she is asking a loan of 7,000 PHP from Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc. to buy additional groceries to her sari-sari store, such as candies, canned goods and biscuits. She hopes this will be a big factor in increasing her usual income every month. Selling in her business is her hobby at this moment of her healing process, she can't go out of their house because she has been struggling to walk up to now.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries for her sari-sari store such as candies, canned goods, and biscuits

loans.name: Kunyetta

texts.en:
Kunyetta is a married woman with nine children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Kunyetta dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' needs in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Umut's Group

texts.en:
Umut is the treasurer of this group. She is 47 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised two daughters and a son. The younger daughter studies at school and the other children are employed. In order to earn money Umut cultivates agricultural products. Selling some part of the harvest she earns about 5000 soms per month. 

At the moment she needs funds to purchase fuel and hire labor for collecting the harvest. In the near future with the profits gained from the trade she plans to repair her house. 

---Where Did This Loan Come From?---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line–People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team-Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and hire labor for collecting the harvest

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a fruit and vegetable vendor in her community. She sells every day just to have funds use for daily expenses. At the age of 58, she is a very industrious woman. The fact is, she is walking some distance to sell to her villagers. Sometimes due to poor sales, she earned just 200 Philippine Pesos (PHP) daily, which caused her to pursue selling in other communities without hesitating to walk a distance. 

Now, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional goods to sell such as cabbage, beans, carrots and eggplants. She hopes the fruit of this will be greater than her usual income every day. Through this she can now provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell such as cabbage, beans, carrots and eggplants

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is 25 years old. He lives in Koti village, Tavush marz, with his wife, his son and grandmother. 

Arman has a farm where he breeds pigs, turkeys, chickens and rabbits. Also he grows wheat. He sells pork, eggs, chicken and turkey meat to bulk buyers. But Arman's principal source of income is fodder threshing: his fellow villagers bring fodder to him and Arman grinds it for a fee. Thanks to his occupations Arman has been able to sustain his family, buy necessary furniture, and repair his house. 

Arman says that selling ground fodder is more profitable than just grind it for a fee. So he decided to buy a large lot of fodder, grind it and sell it. Therefore he asks for an 800,000 Armenian Dram (AMD) loan. This is Arman's third loan from Nor Horizon and he has never delayed his repayments.

loans.use: To buy and grind a large lot of fodder

loans.name: Dogo

texts.en:
Dogo is a married man with two children both of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing. 

For the past five years, he has operated a "boda boda" (motorcycle transport) business; his potential customers are neighbours and passersby. In addition he also operates a spare parts shop, selling retail; this is his other source of income. Dogo dreams of expanding his shop to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase spare parts to add to his stock of spare parts. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his spare parts shop.

loans.name: Remalyn

texts.en:
Remalyn is 34 years old and has been engaged in buying and selling fruit and vegetables for four years. To improve their living conditions even more, her husband is currently working as a Security Guard in Manila. They are helping each other to achieve a comfortable life. The couple is blessed with two children, who are currently studying.


Remalyn is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy coconuts, beans, ginger, onions, and garlic as additional goods to sell. She is hoping to increase her usual income in order to provide for the needs of her children especially for their educational purposes.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, beans, ginger, onions, and garlic as additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a seamstress who uses her sewing and embroidery skills for the benefit of her family. She earns a reasonable income every month that allows her to pay the school fees of her three children who are studying in different classes. Her youngest daughter is only one year old. 

Her husband operates a grocery store in the market. He offers his customers different grocery items like spices, soaps, and lentils at reasonable rates. Abida has applied for a loan from Asasah, a Kiva partner, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more groceries for his store, which will enable him to offer multiple products to his clients and fulfill their needs on time. 

Abida is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and that he will be able to increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 54 years old and owns a motorcycle, which her husband has been operating for almost a year. She can manage to drive it but due to her older age, she gave the permission to her husband to handle her motorcycle. As of now, they are earning P300 per day which they usually use to buy their daily needs such as food.	

Rebecca wants to increase their everyday income but because of deterioration to her motorcycle, they have little opportunity to acquire a higher income. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy new tires and as maintenance for her motorcycle.


She hopes this will lead to improving their income in order to provide for all their needs as well as to uplift their underprivileged lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy new tires and utilize the rest for maintenance for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Mwangeka

texts.en:
Mwangeka is a single man who owns a house that neither has electricity  nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby.  He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. Mwangeka dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is an elementary graduate who did not pursue her studies due to the poor situation of her parents. For this reason, she was not be able to look for a better job to improve their standard of living. But despite that, this 59-year-old woman opened a sari-sari (variety) store as a source of income. It serves to cover their everyday basic expenses. This leads her to want to develop her business.


Now, she is asking for a loan in the amount of P5,000 to buy grocery items such as bread, cooking oil, sugar, and coffee. She hopes this will attract more customers and might be a big help to increase her net income. Then she could continue to send her three children to college. She is expecting the progress of her business through the help of Alalay Sa Kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as bread, cooking oil, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is 30 years old, married, and has one son. Her husband has a small grocery store with a low income. 

Salam is requesting a loan from FATEN, which she will use to purchase new home furniture and appliances such as living room furniture, refrigerator, and stove  With the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, it will improve her life positively and offer her family better living conditions. Salam is a conservative woman, so her husband Ihsan is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture and appliances.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 22 years old and has two children. She needs to work in order to provide for her family's needs. She is requesting a loan for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy eggplants, cabbage, beans, and carrots to sell.  Though walking a distance to sell every day is difficult, Joy still has the energy to continue this business because of her children. 

Joy hopes that with her patience and diligence she will earn enough money for her dream, which is to buy a motorcycle that will serve as her transportation in her business.

loans.use: to purchase eggplants, cabbage, beans and carrots to sell.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is married and has six children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, Nelson has operated a retail shop, selling household items such as maize flour, wheat flour, salt, and sugar. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. Nelson dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

Nelson is requesting a loan for  30,000 KES, which he wills use to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize four, sugar, and rice. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize four, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 57-year-old mother of two children who failed to complete their education due to early marriages. However, Aida continues working to help her grandchildren in their studies. Currently engaged in buying and selling vegetables in her community, Aida tires easily at her age as she carries her produce, but the fatigue is worth it when she sells all of her goods.

Despite living alone, Aida seeks to improve her living standards and so, in order to expand her business, she is requesting a loan of P3,000 to buy onions, garlic, ginger, beans, cabbage, carrots and Chinese pechay as additional goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy onions, garlic, ginger, beans, cabbage, carrots and Chinese pechay.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Saumu dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.
 
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of rice, sugar, and salt. She joined Yehu to access loans to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of rice, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase suitcases, school bags, and sandals for men, women and children.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame, a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, Dzame has operated a grocery shop, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business but dreams of expanding it to supply a larger market in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes with a loan of Kshs 30,000.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Migombani Group

texts.en:
Zulfa, who is in her early 30s, is married and has two children who go to school. The owner of a beauty salon business for two years now, she works from 8 a.m to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Zulfa's first loan from Tujijenge, which she will use to buy more salon equipment. Her dream is to one day be able to send her children to good schools. Zulfa will share this loan with her loan group "Migombani," which has a total of 23 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Mbodze dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and salt. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with two adult sons. She sells various products like plastic bags, toilet paper, napkins, and artificial flowers at the central market in Pavlograd City. Tatyana has been in this business for 16 years. Being polite and offering good products at low prices has helped Tatyana to develop her business well. 

This business is the only source of her family income. Tatyana would like to borrow 5,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She is hoping to make additional income and help her youngest son by paying part of his college tuition.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with six children whom all are adults. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business to cover a large market in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Ng'ombe

texts.en:
Ng'ombe is a married woman with five children, all of whom graduated from school.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition she also operates a charcoal selling business, which she earns her other source of income.  She hopes to excel in her businesses and establish another business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar for the retail shop.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar, for the retail shop.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
This is Nerissa.  She is a 49 year old resident of Pasay City in the Philippines.  She is married to Emmanuel who is a driver, and she is a mother to three children.  She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Nerissa oversees operations of their vehicle rental business.  They have two L300 vans that they offer to be rented for cargo or for people who need vehicles when transferring household materials to other places.  They provide their services within the city and to nearby provinces.  Aside from this she also earns income from making rugs.  She earns a minimum of 5000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 17,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and provide maintenance for her vans.  She expects a boost in her business as she expands.  

Nerissa hopes to have her own house someday and dreams to be able to give her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work on her business.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their vehicles.

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a grocery selling business, selling from her home to neighbours and passersby.  She faces the major challenge of high cost transportation in her business.  Shida dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions, and green vegetables.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions, and green vegetables.

loans.name: Egam

texts.ru: Эгам умный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и у них трое детей. Более 20 лет он занимается скотоводством. Эгам хочет, чтоб его семья жили в хороших условиях жизни и в хороших красивых домах. Он хочет отремонтировать свой дом с целью улучшения свое жилищное условия. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони. Он заранее благодарить всех вас за вашу поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Egam is an intelligent and goal-oriented person. He is married and has three children. He has been raising animals for over 20 years. Egam wants his family to have a good quality of life and good, attractive  housing. He would like to have his house repaired in order to improve his living condition. With this goal in mind, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 TJS. He thanks all of you in advance for your support and help.

loans.use: to have home repair work done

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is a market entrepreneur from Pavlograd.  She is divorced with a 19-year-old daughter.  Galina sells women's clothing in the central marketplace of her home town.  She offers a nice clothing selection of various sizes for different age groups.  Galina launched her venture 17 years ago.  Experience working in the trade and professionalism have helped her increase her inventory up to 60,000 Grivnyas. 

Galina is seeking a loan of 6,000 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal clothing for fall and winter. Her business is the only source of income in the family. Galina's daughter is a college student and lives with her at the moment.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing for fall and winter.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married woman with four children going to school.  They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated livestock for the sale of cow milk.  She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.  During dry season it becomes difficult for the cows to get grass to feed on.  Tabu dreams of expanding and purchasing another cow in the future in order to better her living standards.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cow feeds and medicine for the treatment of her livestock.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cow feeds and medicine for the treatment of her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Dusangirimirimo Group

texts.fr:
Philémon   fait partie du groupe Dusangirimirimo. Le nom du groupe signifie « Partager le travail». Il a 45 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 3 à 19 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  8 ans de primaire.

Philémon est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilisation des fertilisants. Dans les prochaines années, Philémon voudrait agrandir la surface à cultiver le riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Philémon is part of the group Dusangirimirimo. The group's name means "Share the Work". He is 45 years old and married, and he has six children, from 3 to 19 years old. Four of the children are in school. He has an 8th grade education. 

Philémon is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his first one with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy some chemical fertilizers for his rice farm. 

His strategy for the growth of his business is to use fertilizers. In the next few years, Philémon would like to expand his arable land for growing rice. With the profits, he plans on educating his children and taking care of them.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for rice farming

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a grocery shop business, selling to her neighbors and passers-by. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes

loans.name: Tuzamurane/ Rbyr Group

texts.fr:
Zablon fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane. Le nom du groupe signifie « Aidons nous». Il a 32 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 2 à 10 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  7ans de primaire.

Zablon est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilisation des fertilisants pour avoir la grande production du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Zablon voudrait être le grand distributeur dans son région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Zabulon is a member of Tuzamurane Group, whose name means "Let's help ourselves". He's 32 years old, married, and has three children, age 2 to 10. Two of them attend school.

Zabulon attended elementary school for seven years. He's now a rice cultivator who's seeking his second loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business.

His strategy for growing his business is to use fertilizers to increase rice production. In the forthcoming years, Zabulon would like to become a distributor in his region.

With his profits, he intends to provide education and healthcare to his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy computers

loans.name: Rome

texts.en:
Rome is a married man with nine children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, he has operated a posho mill business, grinding maize for flour. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase sacks of maize for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize for sale

loans.name: Ndegwa

texts.en:
Ndegwa is a married man with two children who attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passers-by. He faces a major challenge from the high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Mirsaid

texts.ru: Мирсаид занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В основном он выращивает овощи, такие как лук, морковь, картошка и другие сельхоз культуры. А также он выращивает пшеницу. Мисаид работает усердно и хочет развивать свой бизнес. Он хотел бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений для обработки земли.
texts.en: Mirsaid is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He primarily grows vegetables, such as onions, carrots, potatoes and other agricultural crops.  He also grows wheat.  Mirsaid works diligently and wants to develop his business.  He wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers to treat the land.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Moris

texts.en:
Moris is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

For the past two years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passers-by. He faces a major challenge from the seasonality of his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet was born in 1959. He is married and lives in Noyemberyan city, Tavush region, not far from Ijevan city. His family consists of his wife, who works as a librarian, and two school-aged daughters. 

For about 20 years, Hamlet worked as a mechanical engineer in one of Abovyan's city factories, but since 2003 he has been trading in jewelry and souvenirs. With the income from his business, Hamlet supports his family and has been able to buy new furniture for his house and improve his family's living conditions. 

Recently Hamlet diversified his business: now he sells not only jewelry and souvenirs, but also sunglasses. 

Hamlet intends to buy his own place for his business, which will reduce his business expenses. He says that, thanks to his business income, he has already saved some money to buy a small stall. 

Hamlet is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy an assortment of jewelry and to buy vases, photo frames, tea and coffee to sell. He plans to add future income to his saved money. Hamlet hopes to buy his own place very soon.   

This is Hamlet's second loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and vases, photo frames, tea and coffee to sell

loans.name: Dukorerehamwe Zone 2 Group

texts.fr:
Jean  fait partie du groupe Dukorerehamwe/zone 2. Le nom du groupe signifie « travaillons ensemble ». Il a 30 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 3 à 8 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de secondaire.

Jean est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’achat des autres champs. Dans les prochaines années, Jean voudrait de construire une maison  de stockage du riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean is a member of the Dukorerehamwe group in zone 2. The group's name means "let’s work together". Jean is 30 years old and married with four children aged 3 to 8. Two of them are in school. Jean himself attended six years of high school.

Jean is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his credit to buy fertilizers.

His business growth strategy is to acquire additional farming fields. In the coming years, he wants to build a rice storage installation. With the profits, he plans to provide for his children’s education and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his rice farming activity

loans.name: Twitezimbere /cyrkr Group

texts.fr:
Domitien  fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere. Le nom du groupe signifie « développement des membres». Il a 32 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 1 à 12 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  4 ans de primaire.

Domitien est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionnées. Dans les prochaines années, Domitien voudrait d’acheter d’autres champs de culture du riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Domitien belongs to the Twitezimbere group. The name of this group means " development of the members". He is 32 years old and married with six children, whose ages range from one to 12 years old; three of them are at school. He himself has four years of primary education.

Domitien is a rice farmer. This is his first loan from ACB and he is going to use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming activity.

He plans to grow his business by using selected seeds. In the next few years, Domitien would like to buy other rice-growing fields. With the profits he makes he is planning to educate and look after his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming activity

loans.name: Dukundubuhinzi №3 A / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Philipe  fait partie du groupe Dukundubuhinzi No 3 A / RSZ. Le nom du groupe signifie « ceux qui aiment à cultiver ». Il a 38 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 3 à 6 ans, dont 1 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  2 ans de secondaire.

Philipe est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionnée du riz et utilisation des fertilisants. Dans les prochaines années, Philipe voudrait acheter d’autres champs. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Philipe belongs to the Dukundubuhinzi no. 3A/RSZ group. The name of this group means " those who like farming". He is 38 years old and married with two children, who are three and six years old respectively; one of them is at school. He himself has two years of secondary education.

Philipe is a rice farmer. This is his first loan from ACB and he is going to use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming activity.

He plans to grow his business by selective sowing of rice seeds and using fertilizers. In the next few years, Philipe would like to buy other fields. With the profits he makes he is planning to educate and look after his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming activity

loans.name: Ingobokarugo Group

texts.fr:
Théodore  fait partie du groupe Ingoboka. Le nom du groupe signifie « Help in need  ». Il a 37ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 5 à 12 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 3 ans de secondaire.

Théodore est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de cultiver la race sélectionnée de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Théodore voudrait être le grand fournisseur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Théodore belongs to the Ingoboka group. The name of this group means "Help in Need". He is 37 years old and married with four children between the ages of five and 12 years old; two of the children are at school. He himself has three years of secondary education.

Théodore  is a rice farmer. This is his first loan from ACB and he is going to use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming activity.

He plans to grow his business by using selected high-quality seeds. In the next few years, Théodore would like to become a large supplier of rice in his region. With the profits he makes he is planning to educate and look after his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming activity

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced and has one child. She owns a small business selling thread and other supplies for knitting and sewing. Irina started this business 5 years ago when she was left without a source of income. Today, her profit is about 5,000 Grivnas a month.

Irina would like to borrow 7,000 Grivnas to purchase assorted stock. She hopes that a large assortment of goods will attract even more clients and increase sales.

loans.use: to purchase assorted stock to sell

loans.name: Hambardzum

texts.en:
Hambardzum is 49 years old. He lives with his wife and a son in Tsovagyugh Village.  He used to work as a driver, and since 1996 he has been doing rescue work.  He believes that his work is very important and a responsible thing to do.

Hambardzum, his wife, and son are also engaged in agriculture. They breed cows and chickens, and they grow wheat and potatoes for sale. They produce milk, eggs and meat that they sell to bulk buyers.  This is Hambardzum’s second loan from Kiva field partner Nor Horizon.  He plans to use this 500.000 AMD loan to buy fodder for his farm animals and seeds for autumn sowing.

loans.use: to buy fodder for farm animals and seeds for autumn sowing

loans.name: Moses A.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of teachers from a primary school in Kenema city, eastern Sierra Leone. Their school was founded in 2002 and currently has an enrollment of 223 pupils and 7 teachers. This is the first loan that teachers of this noble institution will receive from SMT/Kiva lenders, and it will certainly create a lot of improvements in the lives of these borrowers.

Moses, the 49-year-old leader of this group, was born in Bunumbu, located in eastern Sierra Leone. In the teaching profession for 31 years now. Moses is the married father of three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school. He will use his share of the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Saodatkhon

texts.ru: Саодатхон умная и честная женщина. Она вдова и любящая мать 3 детей. Ей тяжело одному обеспечить своих детей. Несмотря на все трудности, она работает усердно, чтобы содержит их в хороших условиях жизни. Чтобы зарабатывать на обеспечение семьи она начала заниматься торговаться в базаре. В 2000 году она начала свой бизнес с продажей женской и мужской верхней одежды, а постепенно перешла на продажу женских одежд. Саодатхон хотела бы получить займ для покупки новых одежд с целью расширения бизнеса и пополнения оборотного капитала. Она заранее благодарна вам всех за ваше внимание и поддержки.
texts.en: Saodatkhon is a smart and honest woman.  She is a widow and is loving mother of three children.  It is hard for her to provide for her children by herself, but, despite the difficulties, she works diligently to provide a good quality of life for them.  In order to earn money and support her family, Saodatkhon became involved in retail sales at the market.  She started her business in 2000 with the sales of women's and men's outerwear and gradually transitioned to selling women's clothing.  Saodatkhon wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of new clothing in order to expand her business and add to her revolving capital.  She thanks all of you in advance for your attentiveness and support.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby.  She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Juliet M.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school in Kenema city.  Their school was established in 1995 by the Methodist Mission to promote education in the city and it's surrounding area.  The school is staffed with five teachers and has enrollment of 72 pupils. 

School staff from this institution, like many other school's staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans.  With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise have not been able to accomplish with their salaries alone.  But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children.  Others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in a business.  At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries.  The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayments to SMT on their behalf.

47 year old Juliet is the leader of this group of teachers.  Juliet was born in a place call Siama, in eastern Sierra Leone.  She is married and has two children, one of whom is in college.  Juliet has been in the teaching profession for 26 years now.  She has requested this loan in order to pay college fees for her child.

loans.use: to pay college fees for her child.

loans.name: Tuyana

texts.en:
Tuyana is single.  She runs a small enterprise selling women’s clothing, jewelry, scarves, socks, leggings, and similar products in the central market.  She has been in this trade for 17 years and has gained much experience that helps her to be successful in her business.

Tuyana is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase fall and winter inventory.  She is hoping to use additional funding to grow and expand her trade and, as a result, her income.  Tuyana is an entrepreneur of integrity.  Her professional management skills and friendly customer service have ensured her business a stable standing in this niche market.

loans.use: to purchase fall and winter inventory for her clothing store.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, Nyevu has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES, Nyevu wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Abdukhalim

texts.ru: Абдухалим женат и любящий отец 4 детей. Он ответственный и целеустремленный человек. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Абдухалим в основном  выращивает лук. Он хочет купить минеральных удобрений для переработки земли с целью получения хорошего урожая. А также ему нужны деньги для оплаты труда работников. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 10000 Сомони. Он заранее благодарить всех кредиторов, кто будут поддерживать его.
texts.en: Abdukhalim is married and is a loving father of four children.  He is a responsible and goal-oriented person.  He is involved in growing agricultural crops.  Abdukhalim primarily grows onions.  He wants to buy mineral fertilizers to treat the land in order to get a good harvest.  He also needs money to pay for his employees' work.  This is why he is requesting a loan in the sum of 10,000 Somoni.  Abdukhalim thanks all creditors, who will support him.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and to pay employees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cotton clothes, jeans, shirts, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Mgalla

texts.en:
Mgalla is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, Mgalla has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, Mgalla wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and salt. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is divorced. She has a grown daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, Ukraine, where she sells clothing merchandise in one of the local marketplaces. Nina is an experienced entrepreneur. She has been in this business for 13 years. Currently, she has about 40,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her monthly gross income amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas. 

Nina is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to increase the variety of assorted merchandise she offers for sale in her kiosk. She is hoping to continue developing her business to ensure a stable future for her family. Nina hopes her business remains stable so she can continue supporting her daughter and grandson as well as her elderly father who is 91 years old and lives with her.

loans.use: to increase the variety of assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more generators for sale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single woman with three children, all of whom have graduated from school. She lives in a rental house with no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She has operated a food business for the past eight years. Her clients are local area residents and school students. She also sells brooms, which contributes to her income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality--there are no sales when the schools are closed. She dreams of starting a café in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase potatoes, cassavas and material for making brooms. She decided to join Yehu because the terms and conditions are favorable and they satisfy her personal needs.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, cassavas and material for making brooms.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with one child in school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and rent. 

She has operated a poultry business for the past three years. She also has a beauty salon. Her clients are local area residents and a café. Her major challenge is the fluctuating price of commodities. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase chicken feed for her chicks. She decided to join Yehu because of the different loan products it offers.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed for her chicks.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 30 years old. He lives in Tsovagyugh village, Gegarkunik marz, with his wife and two sons. His older son attends a school and the younger one attends a kindergarten. Karen’s wife is jobless and helps her husband in animal breeding and land cultivation. 

Karen and his wife raise three cows, four calves, a pig and 15 chickens. They also grow potatoes for sale. They sell milk, meat and potatoes from their farm to their regular customers. 

To increase his family’s income Karen intends to start sheep breeding. He is asking for a 700.000 Armenian dram loan to buy five sheep. Also he wants to buy one more cow for his farm.  
  
This is Karen’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy five sheep and a cow for his developing farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase lumber for her hardware business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with one school going child. Her husband, who is a caretaker at a nearby institution, also provides for their family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are house rent and school fees for her child. 

She has operated a tea leaves selling business for the past two years and her potential clients are the neighbors and retail operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, sometimes you may get low quality tea leaves because of lack of rain. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase more tea leaves for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it’s committed to helping low income earners through giving of loans to uplift their business.

loans.use: To purchase tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a freezer for storing milk and packets of milk for sale.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a single man with no children. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his younger sister. 

He has operated a shoe making business for the past three years and his potential customers are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of lack of customers sometimes. He dreams of expanding his business into a shoe selling shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase shoe soles, shoe shines and leather for his business. He decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase shoe soles, shoe shines and leather for his shoe business.

loans.name: Began

texts.en:
Began is a widowed woman with four children who are all married. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself. 

She has operated a clothes selling business for the past five years; in addition she owns a tuk tuk. Her potential clients are the community members. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transport. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans so that she can be self reliant.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hawadost

texts.en:
Hawadost is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend college while one is attending school. Her husband is an engineer who contributes to the provision of their family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a beauty shop for the past eleven years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of competition from other beauty shop operators. She dreams of opening a beauty collage.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase cosmetics, chemicals and braids for her beauty shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, chemicals and braids for her beauty shop.

loans.name: Twitezimbere/nybshnj Group

texts.fr:
Athanase fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere. Le nom du groupe signifie « se développer entre nous même ». Il a 32 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 3 à 7 ans. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Athanase est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionnée du riz pour récolter la grande quantité. Dans les prochaines années, Athanase voudrait agrandir la surface de culture du riz en achetant d’autres champs de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Athanase is a member of the Twitezimbere group.  The group's name means 'to grow together'.  Athanase is 32 years old, married, and has three children between 3 and 7 years old.  He completed six years of elementary school.

Athanase is a rice grower and this is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice crop.

Athanase's strategy for growing his business is to sow selected rice seed in order to harvest a large quantity of rice.  In the coming years, Athanase would like to expand the area of land he sows with rice by purchasing additional rice fields.  He plans to use his profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice crop

loans.name: Nimambo

texts.en:
Nimambo is a married woman with four school-going children. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has owned real estate houses as a business for the past 10 years; her potential clients are tenants. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by tenants. She dreams of establishing more rental houses in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase building materials to renovate her house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and uplift her life.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Zulekha

texts.en:
Zulekha is a widowed woman with six children; one still attends school while five graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity and school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has owned real-estate houses. Her potential customers are her tenants from the neighboring community. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing more rental houses in the future.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to pay for installation of electricity in her real-estate houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To pay for installation of electricity in her real-estate houses.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is too young for school. Her husband who is employed also contributes to the provision of their family's basic needs. She has a house with no electricity or piped water. Mwanahamisi's greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated as a food vendor for the past eight years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators. She dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Haguruka Dukore 13 B / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Alexianne  fait partie du groupe Hagurukadukore 13 B. Le nom du groupe signifie « Avoir le courage de travailler». Il a 36 ans et il est marié avec 5 enfants de 6 à 16 ans, dont 4 scolarisés et avec une autre personne en charge plus que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est  3 ans de secondaire.

Alexianne est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilisation de fertilisants pour augmenter la productivité du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Alexianne voudrait avoir un stock  de riz enfin de vendre beaucoup plus de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Alexianne is a member of the 'Hagurukadukore 13 B' group.  This group's name means 'Have the Courage to Work'.  Alexianne is 36 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of 6 and 16.  Four of her children are in school and she has one other dependent in addition to her children.  Alexianne completed three years of her secondary education.

Alexianne is a rice grower and this is her first loan cycle with ACB.  She will use her loan to buy chemical fertilizers for her rice crop.

Alexianne's strategy for growing her business is to use fertilizers in order to increase the productivity of her rice.  In the coming years, she would like to have a stock of rice so that she can sell a lot more rice in her region.  She plans to use her profits to educate and care for her children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for her rice crop

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is a single man with no children. He lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is the electricity bill.

He has operated a meat goat selling business for the past two years; his potential clients are community members. He faces a major challenge of competition from other operators. He dreams of owning a house in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase seven goats and pay for transport. He decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase seven goats and pay for transport.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 28 years old. He has two children between the age of 2 and 4. His wife works as a tailor and Alphonse sells fabrics. He has been working in this business for five years. 

Alphonse requested this loan to add more fabrics of different kinds and types to his inventory. The profits will be used in making savings, paying school fees and providing food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Divine

texts.en:
Divine is 24 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 2 children aged 4 years and 7 months. They have not begun school. 

Divine owns a bar which she has run for 5 years. The loan will be used to buy inventory for her bar. She will use the profits to expand her business and provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her bar

loans.name: Chrissecia

texts.en: Chrissecia is 41 years old, married to a businessman. They have five children aged between 1 month and 17 years. She owns a bar which sells local beer. She has been in this business for 12 years. She is requesting this loan to buy more local beers for sale. Chrissecia plans to build her savings from the profits made from the business. In the future, she plans to have different projects.

loans.use: To buy more local beer for sale

loans.name: Liberathe

texts.en: Liberathe is 45 years old and has 7 children aged between 3 and 20. All of her children attend school.  She sells bananas and other food items. She would like to use the loan to buy more goods for her store and become a wholesaler. She has been running this business for 10 years. She would like to reinvest the profits into her business and double its size.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 27 years old and has 2 children aged 6 and 7, both of whom attend school. She is married to a businessman. For the last 8 years, Chantal has been running a general store where she sells several food items wholesale. She would like to use the loan to buy more inventory to sell. The profits will be used to pay school fees and create savings. She would like to start making a profit of one million RWF from her business next year.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is married to a house builder. She has 3 children who are between 3 and 7 and are all currently attending school. Claudine has been selling food in a store for 3 years. She would like a loan to buy more food to stock her store. She will use the profits to build a house, pay school fees, and provide medical insurance for her family. She would like to double the size of her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 26 years old and has 4 children between the ages of 2 and 9. All of them attend school.  She is married to a businessman.  She sells vegetables at her own store which she has been running for 5 years. Olive wants a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. She will use the profits to create savings for her future and pay school fees for her children. She would like to see her business grow and prosper.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Belyse

texts.en: Belyse is 26 years old and married to a taxi driver. They have 2 children aged 1 month and four years. The older one attends school. Belyse sells charcoal which she has been doing for 6 years. She would like to use the loan to buy more charcoal to expand her business.  Belyse would like to use the profits to provide for her family and create savings for her future. She would like to see her business double in size.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Domithila

texts.en: Domithila is 46 years old and has 4 children between the ages of 17 and 22. They all are attending school. She runs a general store that she started 2 years ago where she sells bananas and sorghum beer. She would like to expand her business by buying more bananas and sorghum for sale. She will use the profits to provide for her family and create some savings.  She would like her business to expand and get more profits in the future.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and sorghum for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is taking another Kiva loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) because she wants to boost her M-pesa business (mobile money transfer business). With the loan, she intends to purchase cash float for M-pesa money transfer. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase money float for M-pesa money transfer.

loans.name: Alexie

texts.en: Alexie is 37 years old and has 3 children aged between 2 and 9. All of them are in school. She is married to a businessman and they own a retail food shop which they have run for 6 years.  She will use the loan to expand her inventory. She will use the profits to pay school fees and build savings. She would like to see her business grow and prosper in the future.

loans.use: To buy more food for sale

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a single woman with one child who is too young for school. She lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and house rent. 

She has operated a vegetable stall for the past ten years. Her potential clients are community members. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators. She dreams of starting a goat meat business.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes, and onions to sell at her stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes, and onions to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Simeon Arnulfo

texts.es: Simeón Arnulfo se dedica a brindar el servicio de molino. Desde hace mas de  41 años, que tiene este negocio se levanta desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde todos los días para atender a sus clientes. Simeón tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo  a los cuales tiene que brindarle educación, alimentación y vestimenta. Poco a poco fue mejorando sus ingresos hasta ahora que sigue con su negocio para mejorar los ingresos de su familia. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere con el préstamo realizar mantenimiento de las maquinas y realizarle  mejoras a su local.
texts.en:
Simeón Arnulfois has been working as a miller for 41 years. He has been serving his customers, getting up every day at 5:00 AM and working until 6:00 PM. Simeón has two minor children in his care for whom he must provide education, food and clothing. 

Little by little he has increased his income and now he wants to continue in his work in order to increase the family income. 

He has many dreams about his business and that is why he is asking for a loan, in order to maintain the machines and to make improvements to the premises.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of the machines and to make improvements to the premises

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her rental houses.

loans.name: Diana Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Diana Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general tiene 39 años, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo, que mantener. Ya tiene 2 créditos con Fundación que le han ayudado para aumentar su inventario en su negocio. Con este  nuevo préstamo comprara ciertos artículos del hogar, calzado, cosméticos, ropa en general, prendas de oro y plata y ropa interior. Nos cuenta que negocio le está dando muchas satisfacciones, está viendo el fruto de su trabajo y se siente feliz porque puede ayudar a su hijo.
texts.en: Mrs. Diana Elizabeth sells general merchandise, is 39 years old, a single mom, and raises one child. She has had two loans with Fundación which have helped her stock up her store with more merchandise. With this new loan she will buy household items, shoes, cosmetics, basic items of clothing, pieces of gold, silver, and interior clothes. She tells us that her business is very satisfactory since she is seeing her work's progress and is happy she can provide for her son.

loans.use: buy household items, shoes, cosmetics, basic items of clothing, pieces of gold, silver, and interior clothes.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a single woman with one school-going child. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She has operated a business selling second hand clothes for the past five years. In addition, she sells sodas and ice water, which contributes to her other source of income. Her potential customers are the community members. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of products in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of second hand clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to save money and upgrade her business through taking a loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with one school-going child. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to providing family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are her water bills and electricity bills. 

She has operated a tailoring shop for the past one year. In addition, she offers a dressmaking school. Her potential clients are the local community members. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where demand is high during the end of the month. She dreams of owning a big boutique in town in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase fabrics for her tailoring shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Dédévi Ahoefa

texts.fr:
Dédévi  Ahoefa est une femme  âgé(e) de 33ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 02 enfants.
Dédévi  Ahoefa travaille comme revendeuse de bijoux depuis 1995 après achat au GHANA et BENIN.
