Dédévi  Ahoefa a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des colliers, des boucliers, des bracelets et autres.  
Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle veut aider son conjoint dans les charges du ménage et voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en:
Dédévi Ahoefa is a 33-year-old woman.  She is married to a driver and has two children.  She has been working as a jewelry retailer since 1995.  She buys her goods in Ghana and Benin.

Dédévi Ahoefa has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy necklaces, earrings, bracelets and other items of jewelry.  She says that she uses her profits to help her husband with their household expenses.  She would like to see her children grow up in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina de 49 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de  agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Bernal que pertenece al deparatamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace varios años Celestina se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos), verduras y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en casa para su  seguridad y comodidad, ya que puede atender a la hora que desea, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todas sus obligaciones familiares.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para abastecer su negocio, con el único objetivo de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos que ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Celestina es una persona responsable y dedicada que se preocupa por el binestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Celestina is 49 years old and lives with her husband and child in their own house. They have both running water and electricity and live in Bernal which belongs to the department of Piura. This area is noted for its agriculture and livestock production.

Celestina has ben selling groceries (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs) as well as vegetables and beverages for several years. Her store is located in her house for reasons of security and confort as she can work any time she wants. With the profit she obtains selling her products she tries to cover all the family expenses.

In order to carry on with her business, she has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more merchandise to stock up her store, with the sole purpose of growing her business, having more products on offer for her customers, covering her loan and improving her quality of life. 
 
Celestina is a responsible and dedicated person who cares about her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock her store with groceries.

loans.name: Dédé Abra

texts.fr:
Dédé est une femme  âgé(e) de 20 ans. Elle est mariée å un enseignant. Elle a 02 enfants.
Dédé travaille comme revendeuse de bijoux depuis 2004. Elle vend au Grand Marché de Lomé.
Dédé a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bijoux pour répondre à la demande de la population togolaise.
texts.en: Dédé is a twenty year old woman. She is married to a teacher. She has two children. Dédé has worked as a jewelry reseller since 2004. She sells at the Grand Marché in Lomé. Dédé requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy jewelry to respond to the demands of the Togolese population.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is taking a third Kiva loan for 70,000 KES. With the loan she is requesting, she intends to purchase an electric cutting machine for her butcher shop business. Lydia dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' needs in the future.

loans.use: To purchase an electric cutting machine for her butcher shop

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro de 56 años, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes,  cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Chepen que pertenece al departamento de la Libertad.  Esta zona tiene como principal actividad la agricultura y ganadería.  

Pedro se dedica  a la venta de frutas en el mercado de Chepen, con una experiencia de varios años , es por eso que es muy conocido y tiene su propia clientela,  las ventas de sus productos se han ido incrementando; al igual que sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

El préstamo que solicitó a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla fue de 1500 nuevos soles, el cual lo va utilizar  para comprar mayor cantidad de fruta para abastecer su negocio y su clientela, ya que es consumido diariamente, el aumento de sus ventas le permitirá cubrir su crédito, cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de casa.  Pedro es una persona con muchos aspiraciones y uno de ellos es que con su trabajo y esfuerzo pueda tener más grande su  puesto en el mercado y contar con más comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Pedro is 56 years old and lives with his wife in their own house. His children are all adults and independent. His house has all the basic services and is located in the district of Chepen which belongs to the department of La Libertad. This area's main economic activity is agriculture and livestock.

Pedro sells fruit at the Chepen market and has several years experience doing this. This is why he is well-known and has his own customers. His sales have been growing as has his income to improve his quality of life.

The loan requested by Capital Semilla for him to Edpyme Alternativa was for 1500 nuevos soles (PEN) which he is going to use to buy a bigger fruit supply for his business and customers, as it is eaten daily. The increase in his sales will allow him to cover the loan, fulfilling his household obligations. Pedro is a person with many aspirations one is that with his hard work and effort he will have a larger stand at the market and have more amenities at home.

loans.use: to buy a larger fruit supply for his business and customers.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul de 52 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace 5 años Raul se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo a colocado en su misma casa para su  seguridad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio sea más grande y tenga productos más surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.  Raul es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarles todo lo mejor a los suyos.
texts.en:
Raul is 52 years old and lives with his family in his own house which has no basic services and is located in the rural district of Tambogrande which belongs to the department of Piura. This area is noted for its agriculture, livestock, arts and crafts.

Raul has been selling staples (milk, rice, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, etc) and beverages for the last 5 years. He has located his store in his house for safey reasons. He tries to cover all the household expense and improve his family's quality of life with the profit he makes from selling his products.

In order to be able to expand his business, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles (PEN) to buy more goods with the sole purpose of growing his business and offering a bigger variety of products to his customers. Raul is a responsible person, dedicated and hardworking who cares about providing his family with the best.

loans.use: to buy more goods to stock his store with groceries for his customers.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es: Honorata, de 24 años, es una mujer entusiasta y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su  pareja Richard de 26 años  y su querida hija Samerli de 05 años de edad. Desde muy joven tuvo a su hija, y al ver que la necesidad albergaba su hogar decidió acompañar a su pareja en sus faenas rutinarias, que es la agrícola y desde entonces juntos trabajan para salir de la pobreza. Es así que todos los días sale a trabajar sus fincas sembrando cacao, café y hoja de coca, productos que una ez cosechados son llevados a vender a distintas empresas de chocolates y pastas dentales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad y el horario, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga sw insectos que perjudican sus plantas. Este será su noveno crédito con MFP y espera de un pequeño préstamo para poder seguir desarrollándose y por lo cual esta dispuesta en cumplir con el pago respectivo de su préstamo. Con el crédito le será de mucha utilidad ya que con ello comprará varios costales para poder almacenar sus productos y mas adelante planea comprar nuevas tierras.
texts.en: Honorata is 24 years old. She is an enthusiastic and hardworking woman who lives with her partner Richard, 26 years old, and her beloved daughter Samerli who is 5 years old. She had her daughter at an early age and, on realizing the need for a home, she decided to join her partner in his routine agricultural tasks; since then they have worked together to overcome poverty. This is why she goes out to work her land every day, planting cocoa, coffee and coca leaf, products that once harvested are taken to be sold to different companies that make chocolates and toothpaste. What she likes the best about her work is the freedom and the working hours as she can freely enjoy her green fields. She has been doing this work for 5 years and believes that the hardest part of the job is protecting their crops from insect pests that damage the plants. This will be her 9th loan with MFP and hopes with this small loan to be able to continue growing and as such is willling to make the repayments necessary on her loan. The loan will be very useful as with it she will buy several bags in which to store her products and later plans to buy new land.

loans.use: to buy bags in which to store her products.

loans.name: Ervin Alexander

texts.es: Ervin Alexsander tiene 36 años, el posee una pulpería en su vivienda y está muy surtida con productos de primera necesidad, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela por sus clientes que siempre encuentran lo que necesitan él es un hombre lleno de energía, activo y con muchas ganas de trabajar, piensa que el coraje y la motivación de llegar al éxito en un futuro son elementos esenciales en la vida. Solicita el crédito para la compra de granos básicos,  golosinas,  bebidas, pan, sopas enlatados entre otros.
texts.en: Ervin Alexsander is 36 years old. He runs a grocery store from his house stocked with staples. Lately he has seen a rise in the number of his customers as they always find what they need in his store. He is a man full of energy, active and eager to work. He thinks that the courage and motivation to achieve success in the future are essential elements of life. He is asking for the loan to buy dry grains, sweets, beverages, bread, tinned soup and other such products.

loans.use: to buy dry grains, sweets, beverages, bread, tinned soup and other products.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Maximo de 56 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposa e hijos, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla Maximo es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y mango, una vez que realiza su cosecha sus productos los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Piura y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con la finalidad que con su cosecha obtenga mejoras económicas para su familia.  Maximo es un padre de familia que se preocupa por que los suyos tengan comodidades,  brindandoles lo mejor para salir adelante en la vida.
texts.en:
Maximo, 56, lives in his own house with his wife and children.  The only utility they have is electricity in this rural area in the district of Tambogrande which belongs to the department of Piura.  The area is known for its agriculture, livestock farming and handicrafts.

Maximo is a farmer and has his own cropland where he grows limes and mangos.  At harvest time he sells his produce at the different markets in Piura and makes enough income to cover household expenses.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa 2000 to buy fertilizers which will improve his cropland.  This is to grow better crops in order to improve the family economy.  Maximo worries about his family living comfortably and having the best they can in order to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve his land and increase crop sales.

loans.name: Tujinasue Group

texts.en:
Cecilia, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children who are still going to school.  She has had a pharmacy business for four years now.  She works from 8:30 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use the loan for buying more medicine.  Her dream is to one day be able to open another pharmacy in a different place.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Tujinasue", which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more medicines.

loans.name: Martina De Los A

texts.es: Doña Martina De Los Ángeles quien desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta productos comestibles de consumo diario, atiende su negocio desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y gracias a Dios cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo, que le ayuda a atender el negocio tiene varias ideas en su mente con la que quiere comprar materia prima con el crédito como granos básicos, detergentes, refrescos, golosinas, pan, sopas, papel higiénico, fósforos y otros productos.
texts.en: Mrs. Martina De Los Ángeles, who has been selling everyday snacks for various years, works from 7 in the morning to 9 at night.  She is a hardworking woman and thanks God that she can count on her son's help to work around the store. She has many ideas on how to use her loan such as buying general merchandise like basic grains, detergents, sodas, sweets, bread, soups, toilet paper, matches, and other products.

loans.use: buy general materials such as basic grains, detergents, sodas, sweets, bread, soups, toilet paper, matches, and other products.

loans.name: Las Rosas 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.es:
Flor es L. coordinadora del Grupo Las Rosas 1, 2, 3. Este grupo está compuesto por 15 mujeres dedicadas a las ventas D. ropas, zapatos, cosméticos, entre otros, algunos D. modo ambulante y algunos tienen sus negocios en sus casas. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, en una comunidad D. pocos recursos localizada al norte D. L. capital D. L. República Dominicana. Su familia está compuesta por 2 hijos y su pareja sentimental, actualmente Flor no vive con ningunos D. sus hijos, ya han crecido y han formado sus propias familias. Nos dice que disfruta compartir con sus hijos y nietos, y escuchar música.

Flor está muy emocionada D. recibir su tercer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, el cual invertirá en su Cafetería, L. cual inicio después D. que su hija, quien era L. propietaria anterior, quedo embarazada y al dar a luz, tuvo que dedicarse a cuidar a su bebe, L. cafetería está ubicada en unas D. las escuelas D. su comunidad. También Flor venD. habichuelas hervidas (mujeres en L. comunidades suelen comprar habichuelas hervidas para cocinar, D. esta manera evitan comprar las habichuelas enlatadas).

Sus ganancias serán re-invertidas en sus negocios y para cubrir algunas necesidades D. su hogar. Uno D. sus sueños es ver a sus hijos con vidas estables, tanto en L. estructura D. sus familias como económicas.
texts.en:
Flor is the coordinator of the 'Las Rosas 1, 2, 3' group.  This group has 15 [female] members who sell clothes, shoes, cosmetics and other products.  Some make their sales as street vendors and others have their businesses in their homes.  This group is located in a poor community in the north of Santo Domingo, the capital city of the Dominican Republic.  Flor's family consists of her two children and her partner.  She does not currently live with either of her children because they are grown up and have their own families.  She tells us that she likes to spend time with her children and grandchildren, and listen to music.

Flor is very excited to be receiving her third loan from Esperanza Internacional.  She will invest the money in her café which she started running after her daughter, who used to own it, became pregnant and had a baby.  Her daughter then decided to look after her baby.  The café is located in one of the schools in the community.  In addition, Flor also sells pre-boiled beans (women in the community usually buy pre-boiled beans to cook.  In this way, they can avoid buying canned beans).

Flor's profits will be reinvested in her businesses and she will also use some to cover some of her household needs.  One of her dreams is to see her children with stable lives, both in terms of the structure of their families and their financial situation.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, cookies, sweet treats, beans, etc.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina de 49 años es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Domingo y sus 03 queridos hijos quienes le inspiran valor para seguir adelante y mantenerlos sano y salvo. Los verdes campos de su centro poblado de Palmapampa, ubicado en la selva tropical Ayacuchana, han sido en la vida de Justina un lugar agradable para trabajar y vivir junto a su familia. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora tiene sus propias tierras, siendo su pareja quien más la apoya en éste trabajo. Justina cuida con mucho esmero sus plantas de cacao y Plátano y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar lo cosechado hasta los centros de acopio situados en distintas ciudades de su región. Por tanto solicita el préstamo para ampliar la siembra con mas plantas de cacao ya que es una de las plantas que en menor tiempo brotan sus frutos. Este será su primer crédito y está muy contenta de saber que contará con su apoyo. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará semillas de cacao y así aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
49-year-old Justina is a humble and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, Domingo, and their three beloved children who inspire her to get ahead in life and keep them safe and sound.

The green fields of her village of Palmapampa, located in the tropical rainforest of Ayacucho, have been a pleasant place for Justina as she has worked and lived there together with her family.  Her parents taught her how to farm when she was very young and she now has her own land.  It is her husband who supports her the most in her work.  Justina provides her cacao and banana plants with a lot of care and attention.  What she most enjoys about her work is harvesting her crops.  She has been in this business for 20 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her harvests to the warehouse centers located in the different towns in her region.  

Justina is requesting this loan so that she can sow more cacao plants as this is one of the plants which provides fruit in the least amount of time.  This will be Justina's third loan and she is very happy to know that she will have your support.  With her 1,500 soles, Justina will buy cacao seeds and thereby increase her production.

loans.use: to buy cacao seeds

loans.name: Clever Jose

texts.es: Clever tiene 23 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de nintendos. Desde hace mas de 4 años que tiene este negocio a su cargo. el se hace cargo de la administración de su local, todos los días lo abre desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche la buena atención que brinda a sus clientes, le proporciona una gran ventaja y además el lo inicio porque no tiene competencia pues solamente él tiene este tipo de negocio. Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de controles, discos, televisores, entre otros.
texts.en: Clever José is 23 years old and has a business offering Nintendo services. He has had this business for the last 4 years. He is in charge of managing his premises and every day opens from 8 in the morning until 9 at night. He offers his customers good service which gives him a big advantage and he also started the business because no one offers this kind service in the area; he is the only one. He is asking for a loan to buy television sets, controls, discs and the like.

loans.use: to buy controls, discs, televisions and other such products.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Agustin de 41 años de edad trabaja para El Hospital del Rama desde hace 23 años, desempeñandose como Enfermero Asistencial. Esta solicitando  su 7mo. credito con el objetivo de terminar la construccion de los cuartos en su casa, pues con el credito anterior no culmino la obra, solamente levanto paredes y ahora quiere terminar los detalles que le quedaron pendientes como repellar y embaldosar los cuartos y asi contar con mejores condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en: Agustin is 41 years old and has worked for the Hospital del Rama for the last 23 years as a nurse's assistant. He is asking for his 7th loan with the purpose of finishing the construction of the rooms in his house as with the previous loan the work was not completed, only the walls built. He now wants to finish the details that were pending such as plastering and tiling the rooms and so improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to finish building.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es: Marcos de 45 años de edad trabaja para lEl Hospital del Rama desde hace 18 años, desempeñandose como Guarda de seguridad. Esta solicitando  su 10mo. credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto en su casa para tener mejores condiciones, cabe señalar que el credito anterior lo utilizo para levantar una pared que se encontraba en mal estado.
texts.en: Marcos Tulio is 45 years old and has worked as a watchman at El Rama Hospital for the last 18 years. He is asking for his 10th loan to build a room in his house to improve his living conditions. It is worth mentioning that he used the last loan to erect a wall that was in a bad state of repair.

loans.use: to builld a room.

loans.name: Las Rosas 4 Group

texts.es:
Santa es una D. los miembros del grupo Las Rosas 4, compuesto por 5 mujeres dinámicas y motivadas a trabajar para salir adelante junto a sus familias y comunidad.  Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, en una comunidad D. pocos recursos localizada al norte D. L. capital D. L. República Dominicana. 

Santa junto a su esposo se dedican a L. compra D. metales, como hierro para revenderlos en el mercado D. chatarras, las cuales serán reutilizadas para alguna finalidad. Compran toda clase D. metales, que se encuentran desechados en las calles, casas, empresas, entre otros, esto a parte D. ayudarles con sus ingresos, también ayuda al medio ambiente y a las familias o antiguos propietarios que no sabían que hacer con esas piezas. Santa también se dedica a L. venta D. productos misceláneos.

Este es su segundo préstamo, por lo cual esta muy motivada D. recibirlos, y lista para tener un nuevo capital para sus negocios.  Sus planes para el futuro es poder establecer al menos uno D. sus negocios, y que este pueda ser prospero, y sostenible, D. modo que pueda suplir sus necesidades y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Santa is one of the members of the group Las Rosas 4, which is maD. up of five dynamic women who are motivated to work to get ahead with their families and community.  This group is located in the city of Santo Domingo, a community with few resources located north of the capital of the Dominican Republic.

Santa works with her husband to purchase metals, such as iron, to resell them at the scrap metal market where they will be reused for something.  They buy all types of metals that they find thrown out in the streets, at houses, businesses, and other locations.  In addition to helping them with their income, this also helps the environment and the families or older storekeepers who don't know what to do with these items.  Santa also works selling miscellaneous products.

This is her second loan.  She is very motivated to receive it, and she is ready to have a new source of capital for her businesses.  Her plan for the future is to be able to establish at least one of her stores, and that it is able to be prosperous and sustainable so that she can proviD. the necessities and help her family.

loans.use: to purchase used or scrap metal (iron, bronze, aluminum).

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria  de 42  años de edad es madre soltera de 2 hijos: el mayor de nombre Oscar que estudia en la universidad y trabaja y le apoya a su mamá con los gastos de la casa y Yubelki estudiando la primaria.

Candelaria trabaja como Auxiliar de enfermeria en el Hospital  Asuncion desde hace 14 años, esta solicitando su 8vo credito para mejorar su casa y a la vez tramitar la incripcion del titulo ya que su casita fue construida por medio de un proyecto con Caritas y le falta legalizarla.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a 42 year old single mother with two children. The older son, Oscar, studies in university, works and helps his mother with the household expenses. The other child, Yubelki is in primary school.

Candelaria has worked as a nursing aide at the Asuncion Hospital for 14 years. She is requesting her eighth loan in order to improve her home. It will allow her process the title documents since her home was built through a Caritas project but it still needs to be legalized.

loans.use: continue to improve her home and process the title.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos de 31 años de edad es casado, tiene una hija, labora para como Perito Agricola de hace 6 años. Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de continuar mejorando su casa construyendo un pequeño anexo para la cocina pues la casa es pequeña y necesita mas espacio para brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, age 31, is married and has one daughter.  He has worked as an agricultural expert for six years.

He is requesting his third loan in order to continue improving his house by building a small addition to the kitchen.  The house is very small and needs more space to make the family more comfortable.

loans.use: to build an addition to the kitchen.

loans.name: Marisel De Los Angeles

texts.es: Marisel De los Ángeles de 46 años  se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos,  la cual inició hace 5 años con ingresos propios. Su negocio está ubicado en su vivienda en donde tiene  a sus cerdos, ella tiene que salir a algunas comarcas lejanas para comprar cerdos a buenos precios a pesar de que es un trabajo cansado es algo que le gusta hacer. Su crédito  es con el fin de comprar cerdos, ya que tiene ciertas ofertas y quiere aprovecharlas. Marisel quiere seguir creciendo, aprovechando la demanda del mercado para obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Marisel De los Ángeles is 46 years old.  She buys and sells pigs.  She started five years ago with her own money.  Her business is located at her own house, where she has her pigs.

She needs to go to some far-away regions to buy the pigs at a good price.  In spite of the fact that it is tiring work, it is something that she likes to do.

Her loan is to buy pigs.  There are special offers that she wants to take advantage of.  Marisel wants to keep growing and taking advantage of the demand in the market in order to get good earnings.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Katiuska

texts.es: Katiuska, de 32 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto de ello tienen tres hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tiene su propio techo construido a base de madera y techo de calamina. A pesar de no tener los esttuidos primarios completos, Katiuska no se amilanó ante las adversidades que se les presentaba en el camino, es mas sacó fuerzas para montar su propio negocio. Hoy  produce y comercializa cacao y café, y por tanto recibe ingresos considerables. Su pareja es quien más la ayuda en éstas tareas, pero en temporada de cosecha tiene a cargo de 02 peones,quienes rápidamente extraen sus frutos, siendo llevados a los centros de acopio de su localidad. Su plan a futuro es expandirse en otras zonas, para ello buscará nuevos terrenos de cultivo con la finalidad de progresar. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y siente muy feliz al recibir el apoyo de los financistas ya que sabe que el dinero obtenido le será muy beneficioso en el progreso de su labor. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en contratar peones para que limpien y fertilicen sus tierras y cuiden sus plantas de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Katiuska, age 32, lives with her life partner and their three school age children.  They live in Santa Rosa, where they have their own home built from wood with a tin roof.

Even though Katiuska did not complete elementary school, she is not daunted by the adversities that present themselves along the way.  She even gathered strength to set up her own business.  She now produces and sells cacao and café from which she receives considerable income.    

Her life partner is the one who helps her the most with these jobs.  However, during the harvesting season she has two field workers who help to quickly gather the crops.  The crops are taken to the distribution center in her area.

Her plan for the future is to expand into other zones.  To do so she will look for new fields in order to make progress. 

This is her second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to receive support from the lenders.  She knows that the money received will be very beneficial to her in making progress with her work.  The money that she is requesting will be to pay field workers to clear and fertilize her fields and to take care of her cacao and coffee plants.

loans.use: to pay field workers.

loans.name: Wema Farmers Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wema Farmers Group in Western Kenya! Godfrey is the facilitator of the Wema Farmers group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Godfrey joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Godfrey had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Godfrey was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Godfrey and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from the maize sales, Godfrey will repay his One Acre Fund loan, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Wema Farmers Group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the picture above, the One Acre Fund field officer is on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Unidos Al Futuro Group

texts.es: Esperanza tiene 49 años D. edad es casada y tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales 01 D. ellos dependiente aun ya que está en etapa escolar. Esperanza es una mujer trabajadora que para salir adelante se ha dedicado a diversas actividades comerciales, como venta D. ropa y D. comidas,  gracias a su arduo trabajo  ha  mejorado su vivienda y  aportar en su hogar. Con el buen uso que le dio a sus ingresos, pudo ahorrar y está iniciando un nuevo negocio, instalando en su vivienda una tienda D. abarrotes, pues D. esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos, es por ello que con el fin D. seguir mejorando solicito el crédito para invertir en su nuevo negocio comprando arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche y golosinas. Su meta D. Esperanza es D. crecer en su negocio y llegar a fidelizar a sus clientes. Esperanza es integrante D. la Alcancía Comunal “Unidos al Futuro” grupo que está conformado por 07 socios entusiastas y responsable, ellos están muy agradecidos con el Programa – Prosperidad. Esperanza es la viste una blusa rosada. La señora Odilia no pudo estar presente por motivo D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 49 years old. She is married and has 5 children of which 1 is a dependent even though he attends school. Esperanza is a hardworking woman who in order to get ahead works at several business activities such as selling cloths and food. Thanks to her hard work she has improved her house and brings home an income. By wisely using her income, she was able to save and is starting a new business, setting up a grocery store in her house, as in this way she will obtain a better income. In order to continue improving she is asking for a loan to invest in her new business with the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, milk and sweets. Esperanza's goal is to grow her business and earn her customers' loyalty. Esperanza is a member of the communal bank “Unidos al Futuro” which consists of 7 enthusiastic and responsible members. They are very grateful for the program - Prosperidad. Esperanza is the one wearing the pink blouse. Señora Odilia couldn't attend because of work.

.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk and sweets.

loans.name: Olivia Esther

texts.es:
Olivia es unamadre de familia de 21 años de edad, vive con su hija en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Bernal que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace 3 años Olivia se dedica a la preparación y venta de salchipollo, salchipapas y gaseosas por las noches diariamente, su negocio lo ha instalado en la parte externa de su casa donde vive, los prepara en su mismo domicilio, cuenta con su clientela propia, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos  y renovar su vajilla para que siga brindando un buen servicio, para satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes y con esas ganacias podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Olivia trabaja con mucha dedicación para que poco a poco se supere y logre sus metas trazadas.
texts.en:
Olivia is 21 years old and a mother. She lives with her daughter in her own house which has both water and electricity. It is located in the rural area of Bernal which belongs to the department of Piura. The area is noted for its agriculture and livestock.

Every night for the last 3 years, Olivia has been making and selling sachipollo (chicken and fries), salchpapas (sausage and fries) and soft drinks. Her business is located at the back of the house where she lives. She prepares the fast food dishes in her own home and has her own client base. With the income she obtains she will be able to cover the daily living expenses of her household.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy consumables and replace her tableware so as to continue providing good service and satisfy her customers' needs. With the profits she will be able to pay off her loan and improve her quality of life. Olivia works with a lot of dedication so that slowly she can get ahead and reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy consumables to prepare the food she sells and replace her tableware so as to continue providing good service.

loans.name: Arise And Shine A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Arise and Shine A Group in Western Kenya! Janet is the facilitator of the Arise and Shine group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Janet takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Janet had a good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Janet was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Janet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With the income from the maize sales, Janet will educate her children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Arise and Shine group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the picture above, one member (Kezia) is being represented by her husband, as she could not attend the meeting on the day of this photo.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis Alonso de 27 años, las ganas de salir adelante que tiene cada día son las necesarias para proporcionar el alimento diario. Luis es una persona muy trabajadora, el se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos, lo inicio porque él tiene su finca y le resulta beneficioso este tipo de actividad porque además conoce muy bien las ventajas de este medio de vida. Pues esta es una oportunidad de generar su propio ingreso para el mejor bienestar de su  familia. Este crédito es para la compra de cerdos.
texts.en: Luis Alonso is 27 years old. The desire he has to succeed every day is necessary to provide food every day. Luis is a very hardworking person. He works buying and selling pigs. He started this business because he has his own farm and it is benefits him to do this kind of work as he well knows the advantages of this way of life. This way of life is an opportunity to generate his own income for the well-being of his family. This loan is for the purchase of pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Moka Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Moka Group in Western Kenya!  Jackson is their facilitator. They joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jackson has nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, he had an excellent maize yield harvesting 25 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jackson was only able to harvest 4 1/2 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jackson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With the income from maize sales, Jackson will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Moka group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the picture above, Jackson is pictured with his group members. Their Field Officer at the right in a yellow T-Shirt.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Muyundo Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Muyundo SHG Group in Western Kenya! Florence is the facilitator of the Muyundo SHG Group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Florence takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to the best prices and in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and insure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Florence had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Florence was only able to harvest two bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Florence and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With the income from maize sales, Florence will educate her children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Muyundo SHG Group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lehnerr

texts.es: Lehnerr, de 28 años, es soltero y no tiene hijo alguno. Vive en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana,  donde tiene su propia casa. Apenas tiene secundaria completa, pero eso no lo impidió a que siguiera con sus sueños que tanto había anhelado desde su adolescencia. Es así que tiene su propia carpintería en donde elabora todo tipo de muebles, de acuerdo al gusto y preferencia de los clientes. Hoy en día se siente satisfecho por las ganancias que recibe y esto es gracias al buen acabado de los muebles que realiza. Normalmente trabaja con sus operarios, de esa manera puedan minimizar tiempo y costo en la elaboración de cada mueble. Usualmente su negocio de ebanistería se encuentra ubicado en su propio inmueble de lo cual se siente contento con lo que viene ejerciendo, posteriormente sus ganancias adquiridas lo invertirá en ampliar el espacio de su carpintería, con el propósito de adquirir nuevas maquinarias. Este será su sexto crédito y esta muy contento de  saber que contará una vez más su apoyo. El dinero solicitado, le servirá como fondo de capital para comprar variedad de maderas.
texts.en:
Lehnerr is 28 years old, single, and has no children.  He lives in the town of Santa Rosa, located in the beautiful Ayachucan jungle, where he has his own house.  He barely finished high school, but that has not stopped him from following his dreams that he has had since he was an adolescent.  He has his own carpentry shop where he makes all types of furniture according to the taste and preference of his customers.  He feels satisfied by the income he receives thanks to the good workmanship of the furniture he makes.  

He normally works with his workers to minimize the time and cost of making each piece of furniture.  His woodworking business is located in his own building, and he feels happy with what he has accomplished.  In the past, he used his earnings to increase the space for his carpentry business so that he could acquire new machines.  

This will be his sixth loan, and he is very happy to know that he can once again count on your support.  With the loan requested, he will purchase a variety of woods.

loans.use: to purchase wood of various qualities.

loans.name: Arise And Shine B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Arise and Shine B Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Rose is the facilitator of the Arise and Shine B group. She takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had a very good maize yield harvesting eight bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Pamela was only able to harvest three bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Rose will educate her children and ensure food security.
In 2012, the members of Arise and Shine B group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
In the photograph, Rose is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es: Rosa Elvira se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, desde hace mas de 3 años que tiene este negocio es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos y solamente 1 de sus hijos esta a su cargo. Inicio este medio de vida por sus padres que le enseñaron este tipo de actividad para que ella pudiera obtener un medio de ingreso, actualmente ella esta enseñándoles a sus hijos  este negocio para que el día de mañana tengan su negocio propio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de cerdos. Esta inversión le ayudara para superarse, a través del esfuerzo y el préstamo podrá conseguir una mejor condición.
texts.en: Rosa Elvira has worked for more than three years raising and selling pigs.  She is a single mother of four children and only one of her children is in her care.  She started this work when her parents taught her so that she would have a way to earn money.  She is currently teaching her children this work so that one day they can have their own business.  She is requesting this loan to purchase pigs.  This investment will help her overcome, and with effort and this loan, she will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Busakala West Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Busakala West Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Joseph is the group facilitator. He takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Joseph had an excellent maize yield harvesting twenty bags on three-quarters of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joseph was only able to harvest nine bags of maize on three-quarters of an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Joseph will educate his children, repair his home and invest in livestock rearing.
In 2012, the members of Busakala West Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
Joseph is pictured with his group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Hercules

texts.es:
Hercules de 26 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Hercules desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y aves de corral, su corrales se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su familia.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceado para sus animales, con los ingresos que obtenega pueda cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Hercules es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere y  mejore económicamente.
texts.en:
Hercules, 26, lives with his wife and children in his own house, without basic services, in the rural area of the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura.  The area is known for agriculture, livestock, and crafts.

Hercules has raised and sold sheep and poultry for several years.  His corral is a suitable and extensive area outside his house.  He feeds his animals balanced feed, grains, and natural grass so they will reach an ideal growth to be able to sell them in different markets in the area.  In this way he will have good profits to pay for his family's daily expenses.

He has requested a loan of 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed for his animals.  With the income he makes he will be able to cover his loan and improve his family's quality of life.

Hercules is a hard-working and very responsible person who only wants for his family to improve themselves and to improve economically.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed so his animals will be well fed.

loans.name: Bulimi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bulimi Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Bramuel is the facilitator of the Bulimi Group. He takes care of ten children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Bramuel had a very good maize yield harvesting fifteen bags on two acres of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on two acres of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Bramuel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Bramuel intends to educate his children, ensure food security and pay the loan.
In 2012, the members of Bulimi Group will each plant between one and two acres of maize.
Bramuel is pictured with his group members in the photograph above; their Field Officer is on the right.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sesela Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sesela Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Abraham is the facilitator of the group. He is the father of four children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Abraham had an excellent maize yield harvesting seventeen bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Abraham was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Abraham and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Abraham will educate his children, ensure food security and make his loan repayments.
In 2012, the members of Sesela Group will each plant half an acre of maize.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 37 años, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos.

Manuel se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde pequeño. Su padre fue quien le enseñó a cultivar maíz y maicillo. Actualmente Manuel cultiva independientemente para venta y para consumo en su hogar. Manuel cultiva en una parcela que queda a 3 kilometros de distancia de su casa. Para llevar su cosecha a su casa, Manuel tiene que subir una cuesta con todo su producto. Por esta razón, él necesita la ayuda de un par de novillos que acarreen la carga. En éste momento Manuel no tiene una yunta de novillos propia, por lo que él le paga a terceros por dicho servicio. A veces el tener que contratar un tercero causa atrazos en su trabajo, ya que durante la época de cosecha los dueños de novillos tienen mucha demanda por sus servicios.

Manuel solicitó un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de una yunta de novillos. Teniendo una yunta propia Manuel no tendrá que pagar a alguien más para realizar su trabajo. De ésta manera él no tendrá demoras en su producción, y podra trabajar más eficientemente por su cuenta. Teniendo la yunta de novillos Manuel podrá vivir y trabajar más tranquilamente, y así darle todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 37, married, and has four children. 

Manuel has worked in agriculture since he was a child. His father taught him to grow corn and sorghum. Manuel farms independently both to sell and to consume at home. Manuel cultivates a plot that is 3 kilometers from his house. To bring his harvest home, Manuel has to go uphill with all of his goods. Because of this, he needs the help of a pair of young bulls to transport the load. Presently, Manuel does not have his own yoke of young bulls, so he has to pay a third party for the service. Sometimes having to hire a third party delays his work, since during harvest time, the owners of young bulls have a lot of demand for their services. 

Manuel requests a loan from the Fundación Campo [Rural Foundation] to purchase a yoke of young bulls. With his own yoke, Manuel will not have to pay anyone else in order to do his work. This way, he won’t have delays in his production and will be able to work more efficiently on his behalf. With the yoke of young bulls, Manuel will be able to live and work more peacefully, and this way, provide for all the needs of his children.

loans.use: purchase a yoke of young bulls to carry his harvest.

loans.name: Los Palmares 4 & 5 Group

texts.es:
Ana y su grupo Los Palmares 4 & 5, se encuentra ubicado en la ciudad D. Santo Domingo, en una comunidad D. pocos recursos localizada al norte D. la capital D. la República Dominicana, ellos se dedicar a la venta D. diferentes artículos como: Ropas, cosméticos, calzados, salones D. belleza, tienda D. comestibles, entre otros.

Ana es madre D. 2 hijos, los cuales aun comparten junto a ella y su pareja (padre D. sus hijos) en su humilD. vivienda. Su reto mas difícil ha sido tener su propia casa, por lo cual se ha dedicado a trabajar y así poder lograr sus sueños, D. vivir tranquilos y seguros en una vivienda propia.

Ana está muy emocionada D. recibir su segundo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, su préstamo anterior fue invertido para iniciar su negocio D. ventas D. productos D. limpieza, actualmente tiene una mayor clientela y piensa comprar una caja D. cada producto, para limpieza D. baños, pisos, jabón, detergente para lavar ropa y blanqueador. Sus beneficios serán ahorrados para construir su casa y estudiar; también para ayudar con algunos gastos D. la casa. Ana y todos los demás miembros del grupo, les dan las gracias por su apoyo!!!
texts.en:
Ana and her group, Los Palmares 4 & 5, are located in the city of Santo Domingo, in a community with little resources located to the north of the capital of the Dominican Republic. They make a living selling different items like: clothing, cosmetics, footwear, beauty salons, food stores, among others.

Ana is the mother of two children whom, together with her and her partner (father of her children), still share a humble home. Her biggest challenge has been to obtain her own home, due to which she has spent her time working and by doing so be able to achieve her dreams and live safely and peacefully in her own home.

Ana is thrilled to receive her second loan from Esperanza Internacional. Her previous loan was invested to start her cleaning products business. Currently she has many customers and is thinking about buying a box of each product for cleaning bathrooms, floors, soap, detergent to wash clothes, and bleach. Her profits will be saved to construct her house and to study; also to help with some household expenses. Ana and all the rest of the members of the group thank you for your support!

loans.use: to buy cleaning products, detergent, bleach, soap, etc.

loans.name: Nory Edith

texts.es: Nory compró hilazas y elaboró hamacas y bolsos que vendió entre sus clientes, también invirtió sus utilidades en otro negocio que es la venta de queso y productos agropecuarios en su propia casa. En la actualidad está aplicando a su nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará una parte en materiaa primas e insumos de artesanías para elaborar hamacas y bolsos; otra la invertirá en queso pues ha logrado unas buenas utilidades y rápida rotación de su capital con este negocio y esto la hace muy felíz. Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente: "Han sido muy colaboradores porque logro intereses  bajos, trabajo con una mayor comodidad y estoy agradecida y seguiré pagando sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en: Nory bought yarn and produced hammocks and bags that she sold to her customers. She also invested her profits in another business that sells cheese and agricultural and livestock products from her own home. Currently she is applying for her new Kiva loan, part of which she will use to buy raw materials and handicraft supplies to produce hammocks and bags; the other part she will invest in her cheese business as she has obtained good profits and a fast turnaround of her capital which makes her very happy. Her message to the financial supporters is the following: "You have been very collaborative because I attain low interest rates, I work with greater comfort and I'm thankful and I will continue making my payments."

loans.use: to purchase materials to make hammocks and invest in her cheese business

loans.name: Haraka Haraka Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Haraka Haraka Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Edith is the facilitator of the Haraka Haraka Group. She is a mother of two children. She joined One Acre Fund because it offers the best prices for farming and in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for her family. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Edith and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Edith will educate her children and ensure food security.
In 2012, the members of Haraka Haraka Group will each plant  between half and one acre of maize.

Edith is pictured with her group members in the photograph; their Field Officer is on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza D. 70 años D. edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo D. luz, ubicada en el distrito D. Cayaltí que pertenece a la provincia D. Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

DesD. hace varios años Lorenza se ha dedicado a la venta D. abarrotes (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos), verduras y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en casa para su  seguridad y comodidad, ya que pueD. atender a la hora que desee, con las ganancias por la venta D. sus productos  trata D. cubrir  todas sus obligaciones familiares.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  D. 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad D. mercadería para abastecer su negocio, con el único objetivo D. que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos que ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y mejorar su calidad D. vida.  Lorenza es una persona responsable, dedicada y con muchos años D. experiencia en el negocio,el mismo que a sacado adelante para que su familia se supere en la vida.
texts.en:
Lorenza, 70 years old, lives with her family in their home located in the district Cayaltí that is part of the province Chiclayo. This area is characterized by farming and the raising of livestock. They only utility service she has is electricity.

For many years now Lorenza has maD. a living selling groceries (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs), vegetables, and drinks. She runs her business from her home for her safety and comfort since as such she can work when she would like to. With the profits from the sales of her products she tries to cover all of her family obligations.

In order to be able to implement her business she has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to buy a greater quantity of merchandise with which to supply her business, with the only objective being that her business grow and have more products to offer her customers; to cover her loan and better her quality of life. Lorenza is a responsible, dedicated person, with many years of experience in her business which she has maD. take off so that her family can better itself.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of merchandise to supply her business with food products.

loans.name: Webombia Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Webombia SHG Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Elizabeth is the facilitator of the group. She is a mother of five children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Elizabeth had an excellent maize yield harvesting twelve bags on three-quarters of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Elizabeth was only able to harvest four bags of maize on three-quarters of an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Elizabeth and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Elizabeth will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.
In 2012, the members of Webombia SHG Group will each plant between three-quarters and one acre of maize.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Majorie

texts.es: Marjorie, tiene la edad 30 de años, está soltero y vive con su hijo que es su mayor prioridad. Ella pretende con el crédito comprar productos de belleza para su salón. Ella cuenta con el local donde realiza su trabajo y necesita surtir aun más su salón con productos para la clientela. Ella con esto que hará pretende darles a sus clientes una mejor asistencia y mejores resultados tanto en calidad de productos como diversidad. Ella pretende obtener de esto los mejores resultados para así poder ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida para su futuro.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marjorie, 30, is single and lives with her son, who is her biggest priority.

With the loan she wants to buy beauty products for her salon.  She has a place where she works and needs to stock her salon even more with products for her customers.  With this she will be able to give them better service and results in both quality and variety of products.  From this she hopes for better results to be able to give her son a better quality of life for his future.

This is the first loan that Marjorie has received from FUDECOSUR.  Previously, she had not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Mulembe Women Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mulembe Women Group in Western Kenya! This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Eddah is the facilitator of the Mulembe Women Group. She takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to ensure food security for her family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Eddah had a very good maize yield harvesting twelve bags on three-quarters of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Eddah was only able to harvest four bags of maize on three-quarters of an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eddah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Eddah will ensure food security for the family, and make improvements to their home living conditions.
In 2012, the members of Mulembe Women Group will each plant between three-quarters and one acre of maize.
Eddah is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 28 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Michael de 31 años y sus 02 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. Con mucho esfuerzo Lidia ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella siembra plantas de cacao y palillo, productos que una vez cosechados los lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de Santa Rosa, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus productos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y ayudar con los gastos familiares, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar su siembra, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo, lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta los centros de acopio. Más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su primer crédito y esta contenta de  saber que tendrá el apoyo de ustedes, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su proyecto planeado y por ello se compromete en devolver puntualmente sus cuotas. Lidia solicita el crédito para comprar varios sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras y volverlas productivas con el transcurso del tiempo.
texts.en:
Lidia, 28, is a happy and hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her partner Michael, 31, and their two beloved children, whom she hopes to give a better future.

With great effort Lidia has managed to work her land and make it productive.  She grows cacao and tobacco plants, products that, once harvested, she takes to the city of Santa Rosa to sell wholesale.  Her crops have given her the income necessary to support herself and help with the family expenses.  This is why she hopes to put all her energy into getting this business ahead.

What she likes most about her work is sowing, since she feels very happy doing it.  She has been doing this work for five years and she considers the most difficult thing to be transporting her products to the distribution centers.  She wants to buy more land in the future to increase her crops.

This is her first loan and she is happy to know that she will have your support, since in this way she will feel sure of moving forward with her planned project.  For this reason she is committed to making her payments punctually.

Lidia is requesting the loan to buy several sacks of fertilizer to fertilize her fields and make them productive again in time.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Hermenegildo German

texts.es:
Don Hermenelgildo sigue con sus ventas ambulantes de golosinas y venta de rosquillas, pues siempres ha tenido su pequeño negocio, el cual ha apoyado  a su familia.
Hoy en dia ha hecho mejoras a su vivienda,  es por tal razon, desea aumentar y compra productos variados para seguir obteniendo sus ganancias y poder seguir con la construccion.
Lo que hara con este nuevo financiamiento es la construccion de un muro en la parte de atrás del terreno, ya que el agua le ha hecho una gran sanja y tiene miedo que siga abanzando, es por tal razon reforzara con la construccion del muro.
texts.en:
Mr. Hermenelgildo continues with his mobile sales of doughnuts and other typical Nicaraguan sweets.  He has always had a small business, which has supported his family. 

Currently he has made improvements to his home. It is for this reason that he wants to grow the business and buy a variety of products to continue making money in order to proceed with the construction. 

With this new loan he will construct a wall behind the soil, since water has made a large ditch and he is fearful it will continue.  It is for this reason that he will reinforce it with the construction of the wall.

loans.use: to construct a wall.

loans.name: Bidii Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bidii Group in Western Kenya! 
Jodyna is the facilitator of the Bidii Group. She is a mother of three children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jodyna had an excellent maize yield harvesting twelve bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jodyna was only able to harvest five bags of maize on half an acre of land. It is typical for One Acre Fund farmers to double or triple their maize yields after joining the program.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jodyna and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Jodyna will pay school fees for her children and buy food for the family.
In 2012, the members of Bidii Group will each plant between half and two acres of maize.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Yaner

texts.es: Yaner, tiene la edad 41 de años, está casado y vive con su esposa y 2 hijos. El pretende con el crédito comprar los insumos para la asistencia de sus siembras. El comprara los abonos, y los atomizadores para su mantenimiento sano. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo y se encuentra en crecimiento por lo cual necesita darle la mayor asistencia para salir adelante con el proyecto y obtener buenas cosechas. El pretende obtener la mayor de las ganancias para así brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mejor bienestar económico. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Yaner is 41 years old and is married and living with his wife and 2 children. He hopes to buy inputs to assist with his planting. He will buy fertilizers and  sprays for healthy maintenance.  

He counts on the land to be suitable for cultivation of the crop.  He finds in growing what is needed it allows him to advance with the project and obtain good harvest. He hopes to obtain greater earnings to provide his family a better quality of life and better economic well being. 

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with greater facilities and low interest rates.

loans.use: to assist with his tomato and chili plants.

loans.name: Wake Up Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wake Up SHG Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Beatrice is the facilitator of the Wake Up SHG Group. She takes care of ten children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Beatrice had an excellent maize yield harvesting eleven bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest one and a half bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Beatrice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Beatrice will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.
In 2012, the members of Wake Up SHG Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
Beatrice is pictured with her group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 62 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su familia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo y la misma que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Pedro desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cerdos y aves), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento ideal para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles  para la comprar más animales y su respectiva comida, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Pedro es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a los suyos.
texts.en:
Pedro is 62 years old and lives with his family in their own home, which only services light. It is located in the Cayaltí district near the Chiclayo province and the Lambayeque department.  This area is rich with agriculture and farming. 

From a young age Pedro has been raising and selling barnyard animals (pigs and birds).  His farmyard is in the back part of his house which is spacious and suitable.  He feeds the animals a well balanced diet with natural grains for them to have an ideal growth. Then he will be able to offer them to different markets in the area and receive good earnings in order to pay the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy more animals and their respective food. With the earnings from the sale of his animals he will be able to cover his loan and have a better quality of life.  Pedro is a person that with much strength and determination knows how to advance his own.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their respective food.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es: Elba es madre comunitaria, es decir se dedica a la noble tarea de atender a niños de su barrio en condiciones de pobreza, apoyada por el Estado Colombiano en su programa de nutrición. Ella además de cuidar de niños cuyas madres trabajan o no tienen para su sostenimiento, se dedica al oficio producir artesanías y manualidades, también vende mercancía variada, actividades que inició cuando en condiciones de mujer separada, percibió que los ingresos no alcanzaban para cubrir los gastos de su familia, conformada por 3 hijos en las edades de 8 a 18 años.  Con estas actividades ha logrado salir adelante, desde su propia casa, porque todos sus esfuerzos los ha enfocado en conseguir cada vez mas más, bienestar para su familia. En estos días Elba se propone comprar hilo fino, para elaborar bolsos y mochilas que tiene encargadas, pero requiere tener efectivo disponible y hacer su compra en mayor volumen ahorrando costos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, tercer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que la ha apoyado desde que inicio en ella mediante la metodología de grupos solidarios, donde aprendió el buen manejo de sus créditos y la importancia de pagar puntualmente, como hasta la presente lo hace. Su sueño es tener un almacén muy grande especializado en bolsos y mochilas artesanales propias de su natal población de San Jacinto a quien le debe su aptitud frente al arte.
texts.en:
Elba is a day care worker.  That is, she works at the noble job of taking care of the poor children in her neighborhood, supported by the Colombian government's nutrition program.  Besides taking care of children whose mothers work or who don't have enough to support them, she works making handicrafts and selling different merchandise.

She began these jobs when she was separated, seeing that her income wasn't enough to cover expenses for her family, her three children between the ages of 8 and 18.  With these jobs she has managed to get ahead, from her own home, because more and more she has focused all her effort on her family's well-being.

Currently Elba plans to buy high-quality thread to make purses and knapsacks that have been ordered, but she needs to have the cash available to buy wholesale, to save costs.  This is why she is asking for a Kiva loan, her third loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.
