They want to improve the quality of life for their small daughter, and want her to have a secure inheritance.

loans.use: To install a concrete slab in the patio area of her home.

loans.name: Eulogio Ramiro

texts.es:
Eulogio de 56 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Guadalupe que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  La zona se caracterizapor la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

La labor que Eulogio desarrolla es de maestro de obras de construcción, esta actividad que realiza es eventual, es sólo cuando lo contratan en obras de contrucción, es conocido en la zona donde vive por el buen trabajo que brinda a las personas que lo contratan.  Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para que realice algunos arreglos en su casa y mejore la calidad de vida de su familia.

Eulogio es un padre de familia responsable y trabajador que se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos y todas las mejoras que realiza es para sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Eulogio is 56, and lives with his family in their own house, which has water and electricity. It is located in the Guadalupe district, which is part of the La Libertad department. People in this area make their living from farming and livestock-raising. 

Eulogia is a construction foreman. This work is casual in nature, and he only works when he is hired for a construction project.  He is well known in the area where he lives for the good work he does for the people who hire him. 

He has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 800 nuevos soles, in order to do some repairs on his house, and improve his family's quality of life. Eulogio is a responsible and hard-working parent who is concerned for the well-being of his loved ones.  All the improvements that he is carrying out are meant to help his family get ahead in life.

loans.use: To carry out some repairs to the interior of his house, to provide more household amenities for his family.

loans.name: Walter Americo

texts.es:
El señor Walter tiene 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos de sus cuatro hijos.

Desde muy pequeño a don Walter le ha tocado trabajar fuerte, a él le ha gustado dedicarse a la agricultura y el oficio de estructuras metálicas, empezó a  trabajar de ayudante a la edad de 12 años de edad, para aprender el oficio y ya tiene unos 25 años de desempeñar estas actividades.

Él viaja en su pick up a la ciudad recorre unos diez kilómetros, para comprar los materiales y los insumos agrícolas que necesita, para preparar su cultivos de maíz.

Don Walter solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar el abono y herbicidas, para el buen manejo de su cultivo ya que es en este momento, que necesitan los fertilizantes para obtener una buena cosecha.

Con el préstamo él podrá obtener a tiempo los insumos que necesita para preparar el cultivo, ya que en este momento él no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para comprarlos.

De esta forma él podrá obtener más cantidad de sacos de maíz, por lo que venderá más cantidad de maíz y recibirá mayores ingresos, esto lo ocupara para brindarle una mejor alimentación a sus hijos y a su esposa.

Él espera aumentar la producción para el próximo año y lograr que su taller de estructuras metálicas este mÁs fortalecido, para que sus hijos aprendan bien ese oficio y a cultivar la tierra.
texts.en:
Walter is 53, and lives with his wife and two of his four children. Since he was very little, Walter has had to work hard.  He has chosen to work as a  farmer and metalworker. He began to work as a helper at the age of 12, in order to learn the trade, and now has been doing this work for some 25 years.  He travels to the city in his pick-up, travelling some ten kilometers, in order to buy materials, and the agricultural supplies that he needs to prepare his corn crop.

Walter is applying to Fundación Campo for a loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides for good management of his crop, since at this time he needs fertilizers to get a good harvest. 

With the loan he will be able to get the supplies he needs in time to prepare his crop, since just now he doesn't have enough money to buy them. In this way, he will be able to obtain more sacks of corn, sell more corn, and receive greater income. This will enable him to provide more food for his wife and children. 

He hopes to increase his production by next year, and succeed in building up his metalworking shop, so that his children learn this trade well, and learn to cultivate the land.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies for growing corn.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Maria, de oficio cocinera en un restaurante, con mas de seis años, laborando para el apoyo de su familia, tiene tres hijos, estudiantes, y su esposo trabaja como gestor de compras.
Junto han construido su casa de concreto, aunque ha sido un proceso lento, es por tal razon requiere al financiamiento para poder repellar paredes interna, y poner verjas en la parte del porche, para  seguir con la mejora de su vivienda.
El cual se esta haciendo posible, por medio de Afodenic, materiales a comprar: arena, cemento, hierro y materiales para verjas, soldadura, para comenzar la obra.
Sus planes es seguir trabajando, pues ha veces hay semana que le va muy bien, con las horas extras y la propina, lo que esta comenzando a comprar y vender productos Avon. Teniendo otros ingresos que ayude a poder pagar sus compromisos de pago.
texts.en:
Maria, by trade a restaurant cook for more than six years, works to support her family. She has three children who are students, and her husband works as a purchasing agent.

Together they have built their house of concrete, although it has been a slow process. For that reason, Maria needs the loan to pebbledash internal walls and put iron grating on the porch, in order to continue improving her house.

Through Afodenic, it will be possible for her to buy sand, cement, iron and materials for the grating, and solder in order to start the work.

Her plan is to continue working, since sometimes a week goes very well for her, with extra hours and tips. She is starting to buy and sell Avon products in order to have other sources of income that will help her be able to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to pebbledash internal walls, and to put iron grating on the porch.

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.es:
El Grupo la unión esta conformado por ocho integrantes cada uno con una diferente actividad económica, este grupo se caracteriza por ser muy  entusiastas, alegres y con muchas ganas de trabajar. Ellos han llamado la a su grupo la unión porque ellos son muy unidos y les gusta siempre a poyarse unos con otros, ellos viven en una región donde la principal actividad económica es la siembra de caña para la producción de azúcar.

La Señora Florian es uno de los miembros de este grupo , ella tiene la edad de 33 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria y esta casada con el señor Raul que trabaja como albañil con el cual tiene dos hijas una que estudio el bachillerato y una pequeña que  aun no estudia. Ella dice que desde muy pequeña su madre le enseño a bordar y tejer y hace un poco mas de tres años inicio atrabajar en la elaboración y venta de sus manualidades para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijas.

ella platica que como ya tiene clientes  que le hacen pedidos de servilletas bordadas para los xv años, bautizos y bodas o algunas ocasiones le encargan fundas para cojines con una figura bordada y la orrilla tejida , manteles o blusas tejidas y bordadas, poco a poco se ha dado a conocer en su comunidad y en otras comunidades cercanas y gracias ha esto las ventas son buenas y su negocio va creciendo.

Ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de telas, variedad de hilos, listones, ahugas, pinturas textiles, encajes, pinceles y ganchos para la elaboración de sus productos.

"Muchas gracias por la confianza y el credito que me dieron" Ella desea que este crédito le ayude a dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y continuar expandiendo su negocio.


Los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Alejandra venta de hot-dog y hamburguesas
Odali venta de cosmeticos
Silvia Venta de Antijitos Mexicanos
Concepcion venta de cosmeticos
Florencia venta de catalago
Anabel venta de catalago
Daniel taller mecanico
texts.en:
The La Union Group if made up of eight members, each of whom are in different businesses.  This group stands out for being very enthusiastic, upbeat, and motivated to work.  They have named their group "la unión" because they are very united and they always like to support each other.  They live in an area where the main economic activity is growing sugar cane for sugar production.  

Florian is one of the members of this group.  She is 33 years old, she has a high school education, and she is married to Raul, who works as a bricklayer.  They have two daughters, one who graduated high school and a young one who hasn't started school yet.  She says that since she was very young, her mother taught her how to embroider and knit and a little over three years ago she started to work in making and selling her handicrafts in order to help her husband out with their household expenses and with their daughters' educational expenses.

She says that since she has customers now, they place orders with her for napkins for 15th-birthday parties, baptisms, and weddings, or sometimes they order cushion covers, tablecloths, or knitted blouses, and she makes them.  Little by little, she has become known in her community and in surrounding communities and, thanks to that, her sales have been good and her business is growing.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of fabrics, different threads, ribbons, needles, fabric paints, lace, paintbrushes, and pins to make her products. 

She says, "Thank you for trusting in me and giving me the loan."  She wants this loan to help her offer her family a better quality of life and to continue to expand her business.

The other group members are:
Alejandra - hot dog and hamburger sales
Odali - cosmetics sales
Silvia - typical Mexican snacks sales
Concepción - cosmetics sales
Florencia - catalog sales
Anabel - catalog sales
Daniel - mechanic

loans.use: to sell embroidered blouses, napkins and tablecloths.

loans.name: José Gregorio Hernandez (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Gregorio Hernández se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín (Portoviejo), este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y  del Ecuador.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos mejoran sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Aquí conocimos a la Gissela tiene  20 años  de edad, es madre soltera un hijo de un año de edad. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Estudia Idiomas y lingüística en la Universidad Técnica De  Manabí.

Es una joven madre muy responsable y trabajadora que quiere lo mejor para el futuro de su pequeño hijo, ella para ganarse su propio sustento se dedica a la venta de bisutería y ropa por catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque la mayoría de sus ventas  las realiza en la universidad donde estudia ya que allá tiene la mayoría de sus clientes. Lleva 5 meses en este negocio y le va muy bien ya que le da lo suficiente para sus gastos y los de su pequeño hijo.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y bisutería. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños es terminar sus estudios y darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The José Gregorio Hernández communal bank meets every two weeks in the Junín canton (Portoviejo). This place is known for its friendly, hardworking people and because the best cane liquor in Ecuador is distilled here.  

This is a group of people who decided to start this communal bank. It has helped them a lot since with the loans they improve their small businesses. They work in different activities such as being a merchant, service providers, selling food and more.  

Here we met Gissela. She is 20 years old, and a single mother of a one year old son. She lives in her parents' house. She studies languages and linguistics at the Universidad Técnica De  Manabí.

She is a young, hardworking and very responsible mother who wants the best future for her young son. To earn her own living, she sells jewelry and clothes via catalogue. She sells door to door, although she does most of her sales in the university where she studies, since that's where most of her customers are. She has had this business for 5 months and it is going very well for her, as it brings in enough to pay for her expenses and her son's. 

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as: pants, blouses, shirts and jewelry. This is her first cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because she can get the loans quickly. 
 
Her dream is to finish her studies and give her son the best.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and jewelry.

loans.name: Lisbet Katherine

texts.es:
Lisbet de 21 años de edad, vive con su familia en casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Castilla que pertenece  al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.
  
Desde hace 2 años Lisbet se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, golosinas), verduras, frutas y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su domicilio para su  comodidad, ya que puede atender a cualquier hora, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todas sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería (comestibles) para abastecer su negocio, con el único objetivo de que su negocio sea más grande y esté más surtido de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes;  con las ganancias podrá cubrir su préstamo y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Lisbet es una persona responsable, trabajadora y dedicada, con el objetivo de que su familia tenga mejoras económicas.
texts.en:
Lisbet is 21 years old. She lives with her family in her parents' house, which only has electricity. It is located in the department of Piura. This area is characterized by it farming and cattle ranching activity. 
  
For 2 years, Lisbet has sold groceries (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, and candies) vegetables, fruits and beverages. She has set up her business in her house for convenience, since she can attend to it at any time. With the earnings from selling her products, she tries to cover all of the daily expenses for her home. 

To stock her business, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy a greater quantity of merchandise (edibles). Her only objective for the business is for it to be bigger and with a wider variety for he customers. With the earnings, she will be able to pay for the loan and improve her quality of life. Lisbet is a responsible, hardworking and dedicated person whose objective is for her family to have financial improvement.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of merchandise to stock edible products at her store.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Ángel y su esposa la señora Miriam tienen ya mas de ocho años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva en diferentes partes de la ciudad. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar ropa de invierno que son (Conjuntos deportivos, sudaderas, suéteres, abrigos y zapatos para dama, hombres y niños) por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir en su negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para la familia. 
Desean  mejorar la calidad de vida y que su hijo tenga todo lo necesario para una su futuro.
texts.en: Miguel Ángel and his wife, Miriam, have been selling new and used clothes for over 8 years in various parts of the city.  He’s asking for a loan to buy winter clothes like sports ensembles, sweatshirts, sweaters, coats and women’s, men’s and children’s shoes.  For the moment, he does not have sufficient funds available to be able to invest in his business.  He plans to repay the loan with part of the profits he earns in his business since this is his family’s source of income.  They wish to improve their quality of life and that their son has everything he needs for the future.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María Luisa de 43 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Chulucanas que pertenece  al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.
  
Desde hace 5 años María Luisa se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, golosinas), frutas y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su domicilio para su  comodidad, ya que puede atender a cualquier hora, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todas sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de productos comestibles para abastecer su negocio, con el único objetivo de que su negocio sea más grande y esté más surtido de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes;  con las ganancias podrá cubrir su préstamo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  María Luisa es una persona responsable, trabajadora y empeñosa, con el objetivo de que su familia tenga mejoras económicas  y pueda brindarles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Luisa, 43, lives with her husband and children in her own house which only has electricity and is located in Chulucanas District belonging to Piura Department.  This zone is known for farming and animal husbandry.

María Luisa has been selling groceries for the last five years (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, and snacks), fruit and beverages.  Her store is at home for her comfort because she can tend to it at any time.  With profits obtained from sales she tries to cover all her household’s daily needs.

To stock her store she’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan to buy larger amounts of foodstuffs to stock her store.  Her only objective is that the business is larger and better stocked with merchandise to offer her customers.  With profits she’ll be able to repay the loan and improve her family’s quality of life.  María Luisa is a responsible, enterprising woman whose objective is that her family has improved economy and to provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Aurora De La Asunción

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal 21De Julio.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Aurora, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya son  mayores de edad, el menor tiene 17 años y  estudian en universidad y es el que  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es técnico en refrigeración.

Doña Aurora es una mujer que le encanta el comercio, ella vende zapatos, ropa de todo tipo y productos, Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta  a puerta y trabaja todos los  días tres a cuatro horas por dia sobretodo en las mañanas aunque a veces también vende en las noches, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o en dos partes dependiendo del valor del producto. Tiene más de 5 años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, zapatos  y ropa. Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido.

Su sueño es tener una boutique o un bazar.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the “21 de Julio” communal bank meets every two weeks.

We met Aurora, 55, here.  She’s married and has four children; three of them are adults and the youngest is 17 years old and going to university and  still living with her.  Her husband is a refrigeration technician.

Aurora is a woman who loves commerce.  She sells shoes, all types of clothes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She sells door to door every day from three to four hours daily but mostly in the morning although she sometimes does sell at night.  She sells on credit and collects payments either weekly or in two payments depending on the price of the item.  She’s been in this line of work for more than five years and she does very well.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, shoes and clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank for three years and likes it because the group is very united.  Her dream is to have a boutique or store.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Avon and Zermat brand products.

loans.name: Pacifica Gregoria

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal 21De Julio.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gregoria, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, todos mayores de edad, el menor de ellos vive en su casa ya que es especial y requiere de sus cuidados. Su esposo trabaja en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí.

Doña Gregoria es una mujer muy abnegada y trabajadora que para generara sus propios ingresos trabaja como asesora comercial de un campo santo en la ciudad y también se dedica al comercio, vende bisutería y zapatos por catalogo, realizar sus ventas en sus ratos libres y fines de semana, deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Recién empezó su negocio hace tres meses y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar bisutería y zapatos pues tiene varios pedidos por entregar. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque no piden tantos requisitos como en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the “21 de Julio” communal bank meets every two weeks.

We met Gregoria, 52, here.  She’s married and has three children who are all adults.  The youngest one lives at home because he has special needs and requires care.  Her husband works at the Manabí Technical University.

Gregoria is a very self-sacrificing, hardworking woman who works as a commercial advisor for a municipal cemetery to earn her own income but she also is a merchant: she sells costume jewelry and shoes via catalogue in her free time and on weekends.  She sells on credit and collects payments every weekend.  She started the business recently, three months ago, and is doing very well.

She will use this loan to buy costume jewelry and shoes because she has several pending orders to fill.  This is her first cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because they don’t ask for so many requirements like other credit institutions.  Her dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry and shoes.

loans.name: Sandra Azucena

texts.es:
A la vivienda del la señora Sandra Azucena le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor.
Están solicitando un préstamo para comprar el materia que es (block, cemento, varilla, arena y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejorar) ya que en este momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario y desean que su patrimonio este seguro ya que trabajan casi todo el día.
Doña Sandra Azucena es empleada de una fabrica en el aria de control de calidad de la producción con este sueldo pagaran el crédito ya que su esposo el señor Pedro se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sandra Azucena’s house needs a wall along its perimeter.  She’s asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies (concrete blocks, cement, iron rods and sand and to pay the person who will do the job) because she doesn’t have the necessary money right now and she wants her principal asset to be secure since she works almost all day.

Sandra Azucena is employed in a factory in the quality control department and she’ll use her salary to repay the loan since her husband, Pedro, will take care of family expenses with the income he earns at his job.

loans.use: to build a wall around her house.

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es:
José de 52 años de edad, es soltero, reside en su casa propia junto a unos  familiares, ubicada  en la zona rural de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Es una zona agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

El cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar mango y limón, el ya tiene varios años de experiencia en esta actividad y durante este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho sobre el manejo de cultivos. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar la economía diaria de su familia.

José desea comprar fertilizantes para así brindar mantenimiento a su terreno de cultivo para instalar una nueva plantación de limón. De esta manera obtendrá una buena cosecha. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is 52 years old, single and living in his own house with some relatives in the rural part of Olmos which belongs to Lambayeque Department.  It’s a farming, livestock raising and crafts making zone.

He has a field where he tends to grow mangoes and lemons.  He has several years experience in this activity and during all this time he’s come to learn much about managing these crops.  Income he receives from these activities is used to cover his family’s daily needs.

José wants to buy fertilizer to provide maintenance to his growing fields and to plant a new lemon crop to obtain a good harvest.  To reach this objective he’s needed to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire day workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and to do some repairs to his corrals.

loans.name: Martha Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Martha Guadalupe ha salido adelante desde la separación de su esposo, por lo que en algunas ocasiones se dedico a trabajar para diferentes compañías para poder sostener los gastos del hogar. Hace 2 años tubo la oportunidad de adquirir una concesión de transporte urbano al igual que la compra de un camión para trabarlo, Martha ve que para una mujer este trabajo es muy riesgoso por la delincuencia que hay en país, por lo que pensó en rentar su camión y de esta manera también recibiría ganancias. En este momento el camión necesita mantenimiento por lo que solicita el préstamo para comprar partes, aceites y pagar al mecánico que hará el arreglo. De esta manera seguirá teniendo su camión en mejores condiciones y  recibirá un ingreso para sus gastos.
texts.en: Martha Guadalupe has been able to get ahead since separating from her husband; at times, she has worked for different companies in order to cover her household expenses.  Two years ago, she had the opportunity to buy an urban transportation concession and a bus to work it.  Martha knows that for a woman this type of work is risky, due to the crime that exists in the country, and so she had the idea of renting out her bus and in this way receiving income from it.  At this time, the bus needs some maintenance work, and so she is requesting a loan to buy spare parts, engine oil, and to pay a mechanic to do the repairs.  In this way, she will continue to maintain her bus in the best condition, and so will receive an income as a result of these expenditures.

loans.use: to buy parts and pay for a mechanic

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel de 24 años de edad, es soltero, vive en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Paijan que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Miguel  maneja su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace 2 años aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en la misma zona donde vive, a pesar de la gran cantidad de personas que realizan el mismo trabajo, el trata en lo posible desde muy temprano movilizar una buena cantidad de pasajeros a sus diferentes destinos, y así tenga mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades personales.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1200 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento  de su mototaxi  para seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Miguel es una persona responsable y trabajadora  que lo único que desea es que a sus padres no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Miguel, 24, is single and lives in his own home, which lacks basic utilities and is located in the Paijan district of the department of La Libertad.  The residents of this area work in livestock and animal husbandry.

Miguel has been driving his mototaxi, (a mode of transportation that is used to move people short distances, which carries up to 3 people), for about 2 years.  He does this work in the area where he lives.  In spite of the many people who also do this type of work, he tries as much as possible to move a large quantity of people to their destinations each day, working from the very early hours.  This way he can have a better income to pay his bills and pay for his personal necessities.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,200 Peruvian soles, which will be used for maintenance work on his mototaxi so that he can continue to provide good service to his customers, and improve his quality of life.  Miguel is a responsible and hardworking person; his main concern is to provide his parents with everything they need.

loans.use: to maintain his mototaxi so that he can continue to provide good service to his customers

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es: El señor Patricio es un hombre muy trabajador y un padre responsable que esta dispuesto ofrecer a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida. Patricio es chofer de trasporte urbano desde hace 30 años ofreciendo su servicio en diferentes colonias de la ciudad, de acuerdo la ruta que le toque. Para Patricio es muy importante tener su camión en mejores condiciones ya que es su única fuente de ingresos para cubrir sus gatos. Por tal motivo solicita de un préstamo para comprar auto partes y pagar al mecánico, de esta manera el ofrecerá un mejor servicio y seguridad a sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Patricio is a hard working man and a responsible father that is willing to give his children a better quality of life. 

Patricio has been a city bus driver for 30 years offering his service in various suburbs of the city, according to his assigned route. 

For Patricio it is very important that his bus is in excellent condition as it is his only source of income to pay his household expenses. The reason he is asking for this loan is to buy auto parts and to pay the mechanic as in this way he can offer better service and safety for his passengers.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of his bus

loans.name: Joselito Victor

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo  que se reúne cada quince días en las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, este lugar se lo conoce porque está muy cerca de unas canteras de roca y de allí su nombre.

En este lugar conocimos a don Joselito, tiene 42 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen tres hijas,  dos mayores de edad y una de 10 años que estudian en universidad  y escuela. Su esposa es modista.

El es mecánico automotriz y tiene un taller en su casa en el cual realiza todo tipo de arreglos a carros de todas la marcas y modelos, allí mismo el también vende ciertas partes y refacciones de automóviles, lo cual es un beneficio ya que él mismo realiza el trabajo y también vende las refacciones lo cual le significan ganancias extras, trabaja de lunes a sábado y el domingo solo si tiene algún trabajo que entregar ya que le gusta descansar aunque sea un dia, lleva con su taller 19 años y nunca le ha hecho falta trabajo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar partes, refacciones y aceites para automóviles.  Lleva dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otros lugares. 

Su sueño es que sus hijas sean buenas profesionales.
texts.en:
El Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo gets together twice a month in the outskirts of Portoviejo in the sector known as Las Piedras. This place is known because it is very near some rock quarries, and this is where it gets its name.

In this place we meet Joselito. He is 42 years old, married and has three daughters. Two are adults and one is 10 years old. They attend university and school. His wife is a dressmaker.

He is an auto mechanic and he has a workshop at his home where he fixes all types of cars, all makes and models. He also sells spare parts which earns him extra money. He works Monday through Saturday, and only works on Sunday if he has deliveries to make because he likes to rest if only for one day. He has had his shop for 19 years and he has never been out of work. 

With this loan he will buy necessary and spare parts, and automobile oil. He has been with the communal bank for 2 years and he likes it because the interest is lower than in other places.

His dream is that his daughters become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy needed parts, spare parts and automobile oil

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo de 38 años de edad, es soltero, vive en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Segundo  es la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) desde hace unos años, el lugar donde cría  sus animales en la parte posterior de la casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y granos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela en la ciudad de Piura, también cuenta con tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y una vez que cosecha podrá obtener otro ingreso económico para sus gastos personales. 

Ha solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar el alimento para sus animales y de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados  para ofertarlos a un buen precio. Segundo es una persona conocida en el lugar donde vive porque siempre se preocupa por mejorar en la vida, con el finalidad que en un futuro pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Segundo, 38, is single and lives in his own house, which does not have electricity. They live in the district of Tambogrande in the department of Piura, an area where people farm, raise cattle and make artisan crafts.

For some years, Segundo has raised and sold sheep. He raises them in the back of his house, giving them balanced feed and natural grains. Once they've reached the ideal size and weight he sells them in different markets. He has established customers in the city of Piura. He also has land where he plants limes, which at harvest time provide another source of income for his personal costs.

He asked asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy food for his animals and fertilizers to improve his fields, which will allow him to keep the animals well-fed and get a good price for them. Segundo is well-known in the area where he lives because he's always trying to improve his life, with the goal of having a better quality of life in the future.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizers to improve his farm land.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: La señora María Isabel es una mujer muy trabajadora desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de gorditas de harina y de maíz, lo cual fue un beneficio para ella porque su casa se ubica en una calle muy transitada de la ciudad lo cual su negocio le ha estado funcionado desde que ella comenzó. Para María su mayor prioridad es arreglar su casa y seguir construyendo en la parte alta de su casa para que el negocio este en planta baja por que algunas veces se llena y la gente queda en pie comiendo. Lo cual quiere brindar a su clientela un mejor Servicio y de igual manera a su familia mayor comodidad por que en el crecimiento del negocio, se esta reduciendo el espacio de su vivienda. Para poder seguir con su proyecto necita comprar arena, varillas, cemento y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en: Maria Isabel is a very hardworking woman. For 9 years she has sold flour and corn gorditas [like a thick tortilla, or pita]. Her house is located on a very busy street in the city so her business has been successful from the start. Maria's top priority is fixing her house and completing the second floor so that the business can be on the first floor - sometimes it gets very busy and people have to eat while standing. She wants to give her customers better service and at the same time give her family greater comfort - as the business grows, their living space is getting smaller. In order to complete her project she will need to buy sand, rebar and cement and hire laborers.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Nelly Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo  se reúne cada quince días en las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, este lugar se lo conoce porque está muy cerca de unas canteras de roca y de allí su nombre.

En este lugar conocimos  a La señora Nelly Tiene 44 años está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y el ultimo de  17 años que estudia el último año de colegio. Su esposo es albañil.

Doña Nelly para ayudarse y ayudar a sus hijos se dedica al comercio, vende  productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios), trabaja desde las 6h30 en una casa como empleada domestica pero en las tardes se dedica a  vender sus productos por toda la localidad donde vive, deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana,  lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad comercial y le ha ido muy bien ya que con esto ha podido ayudar  a sus hijos con los estudios.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que ha recibido ya que con los créditos ha podido mejorar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es terminar por completo su casa.
texts.en:
The village bank Caminantes de Cristo meets every 15 days on the outskirts of Portoviejo in the sector known as Las Piedras [The Stones], an area that is very near to the rock quarries, hence its name.  

Here we meet Nelly, 44. She is married and has 3 children, 2 of whom are grown and the youngest, 17, is in their last year of high school. Her husband is a mason.

Nelly, in order to help herself and her children, is a merchant, selling Yanbal products (beauty products, perfume and accessories). She starts work at 6:30 as a domestic employee, but in the afternoons she sells her products all over her neighborhood. She sells on credit and collects payments every weekend. She has been doing this for more than 10 years and it has gone very well and has allowed her to help her kids with their schooling.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics and lotions. She is a founding member of this village bank and likes it because the help that she has received through the loans has allowed her to improve her business.

Her dream is to finish constructing her home.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics and lotions.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Elizabeth es una mujer muy emprendedora que les gusta el negocio por tal motivo pensó en poner venta de ropa usada  en una de las colonias de la ciudad, el cual se podría desarrollar como una buena negociante. Con el negocio ya tiene 16 años ofreciendo a su clientela una buena atención, un mejor servicio y variedad de estilos de ropa. Desde que comenzó su negocio vio que daba resultados por lo que siguió adelante ya que seria la forma de tener un ingreso extra aparte del que percibía por su esposo que trabaja como albañil por cuenta propia.
Sandra Elizabeth desea comprar ropa de temporada de tiempo de frio, por que en este momento ya sus clientes le están solicitando y ve que es una buena oportunidad de tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sandra Elizabeth is a very enterprising woman who likes business.  Because of that she decided to establish a used clothes sales business in one of the city’s neighborhoods where she can develop as a good merchant.  She’s been in business for 16 years offering good customer service and a variety of styles of clothing.  Since she began her business she noticed that it produced good results so she continued going forward with it since it would be a way to earn extra money aside from what her husband earned working as a bricklayer.

Sandra Elizabeth wants to buy cold weather seasonal clothes because her customers are starting to request it already and it’s a good opportunity to earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy cold weather seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Joselyn Liceth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo  se reúne cada quince días en las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, este lugar se lo conoce porque está muy cerca de unas canteras de roca y de allí su nombre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Joselyn, tiene 19 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una bebe de 4 meses de nacida la cual es su razón de vivir. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa en la ciudad.

Es una joven madre y  ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su marido con los gastos  se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo de la marca Mi Ángel y de productos de Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta  y trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Últimamente se le han complicado un poco las ventas porque tiene que cargar a su bebe pero igual ella continua ya que con esto se ayuda ella y a su esposo. Empezó su negocio con su primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal, es la secretaria del mismo  y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y  fáciles de pagar. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia pues vive en casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
The “Caminantes de Cristo” communal bank meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Portoviejo in a sector known as Las Piedras.  This place is known because it’s near a rock quarry, hence its name.

We met Joselyn, 19, here.  She’s married and has a four-month-old baby girl who is her reason to live.  Her husband’s employed in a firm in the city.

She is a young mother and housewife who in order to earn her own income and help her husband with expenses sells clothing via catalogue of the Mi Ángel brand and also sells Esika brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women’s accessories).  She sells door to door and works three days a week.  She sells on credit and collects payments every weekend.  Lately, sales have been a little complicated for her because she has to carry her little baby but she continues anyway because it helps her and her husband.  She started the business with the first loan she got from the bank.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and underwear.  It’s the third cycle in the communal bank; she’s its Secretary and she likes it because loans are quick and easy to repay.  Her dream is to have a house of her own because she lives in her in-laws’ house.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and underwear.

loans.name: Charito

texts.es:
Charito de 34 años, vive en su casa propia con su familia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona   se caracterizan por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

Charito se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cerdos y aves de corral), desde hace 3 años, cuenta con sus corrales apropiados para sus animales, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para engordarlos y pueda venderlos a sus clientes a un buen precio, obteniendo ingresos para solventar sus necesidades familiares.

Al observar Charito que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de animales de corral y su respectivo alimento para los mismos, al tenerlos bien alimentados tendrá mas ventas de sus animales y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito otorgado, mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Charito, 34, lives in her own house that only has electricity with her family; it’s located in Tambogrande District that belongs to Piura Department.  This zone is noted for farming, animal husbandry and crafts making.

Charito has been raising small farm animals (pigs and barnyard fowl) to sell for the last three years.  She has corrals that are appropriate for her animals.  She feeds them balanced feed and natural grasses to fatten them up so that she can sell them to her customers for good prices obtaining income to meet family needs.

Seeing that her business is more prosperous every day, Charito has felt it necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy larger numbers of animals and their respective feed to keep them well fed and have more sales.  Income obtained will allow her to repay the loan while improving her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of small farm animals and their feed.

loans.name: Sandra Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo  se reúne cada quince días en las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, este lugar se lo conoce porque está muy cerca de unas canteras de roca y de allí su nombre.

En este lugar conocimos a  la señora Sandra, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre  de la cual tiene  4 hijos de 11, 9, 6 y 3 años de edad, el mayor este año empezó a estudiar en colegio y los dos pequeños estudian en escuela. Su esposo es chofer realiza fletes en su carro.

Doña Sandra con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica al comercio, vende  productos Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja todos los días, ella aprovecha las mañanas cuando sus hijos están en  la escuela para realizar sus ventas y en las tardes se dedica a ayudar a sus hijos con las tareas de la escuela, deja a crédito sus productos y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva más de tres años dedicada a esta actividad comercial y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio del banco  y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado con los créditos. 

Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
The “Caminantes de Cristo” communal bank meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Portoviejo in a sector known as Las Piedras.  This place is known because it’s near a rock quarry, hence its name.

We met Sandra, 31, here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has four children who are 11, 9, 6 and 3 years of age.  The eldest started secondary school this year and the two younger ones go to elementary school.  Her husband is a driver; he transports freight in his vehicle.

To earn her own income, Sandra is a merchant.  She sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, perfume and accessories).  She sells door to door and works every day.  She takes advantage of mornings while her children are at school to do her sales and in the afternoon she helps her children do their homework.  She sells on credit and collects payment every weekend.  She’s been in this commercial activity for more than three years and she’s done quite well.

She will use this loan to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams.  She’s been in the communal bank almost since its beginning and she likes it because of the help she’s been given with the loans.  Her dream is to see her children complete their schooling and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Deysi Isabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo  se reúne cada quince días en las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, este lugar se lo conoce porque está muy cerca de unas canteras de roca y de allí su nombre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Daysi, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de tres años y seis meses. Su esposo es agente vendedor. Ella lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.

Doña Deysi es una mujer muy trabajadora pues ella trabaja de asistente contable en una pequeña empresa en la ciudad y también se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja de tres  a cuatro días de la semana pero por las noches, también vende en su lugar de trabajo a compañeros de trabajo, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. 

 Su sueño es tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
The “Caminantes de Cristo” communal bank meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Portoviejo in a sector known as Las Piedras.  This place is known because it’s near a rock quarry, hence its name.

We met Daysi, 26, here.  She’s married and has a three-and-a-half-year-old son.  Her husband’s a salesman.  She’s been in the communal bank for two years and likes it because of the ease in getting loans.

Daysi is a very hardworking woman because she’s employed as an accountant’s assistant in a small firm in the city and she also is a merchant.  She sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She sells door to door and works from three to four days a week during the evenings.  She also sells to her coworkers at her place of employment.  She sells on credit and collects payments every two weeks.  She’s been in this activity for four years and does very well.  This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.  Her dream is to have a commercial locale.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Blanca Bertha

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo  se reúne cada quince días en las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, este lugar se lo conoce porque está muy cerca de unas canteras de roca y de allí su nombre.

Aquí vive  la señora Blanca tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y de  esta relación tiene tres hijos y también crio desde muy pequeña a una hija de su esposo  que para ella es como si fuera su hija, sus dos hijas mayores están estudiando en Universidad y los dos menores en colegio. Su esposo es Biólogo Marino y trabaja en un laboratorio de larvas en Manta.

Doña Blanca tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, artículos de bazar y una que otra  medicina. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00  hasta las 19h00, ella allí además de ganarse algo por su cuenta se entretiene y se entera de lo que sucede  en su localidad, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio cuando están desocupados, lleva tres años con su negocio y está muy contenta con su tienda.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del Banco y le gusta porque con los créditos cada vez aumenta más su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son aumentar su negocio y que sus hijos sean  profesionales.
texts.en:
Caminantes de Cristo [Christ's Travelers] Community Bank meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Portoviejo, in the area known as Las Piedras [the Stones]. Its name comes from its close proximity to some rock quarries. 

This is where Blanca lives. She is 37 years old, married, and has three children with her spouse. She also raised her husband's daughter from a young age, and for Blanca, it's as if she were her own daughter. Blanca's two older daughters study at the university, and the two younger children go to school. Her husband is a marine biologist and works in a shrimp hatchery in Manta. 

Blanca has a grocery story in her house where she sells basic necessity items, stationary products, and medicine. She works every day from 6AM to 7PM. In addition to earning a living, she keeps herself busy and is informed on what's happening in her neighborhood. Her children help her in the shop when they're not busy. Blanca has had her business for three years and is very satisfied with her shop. 

This loan will be used to buy basic necessity goods to supply her store. Blanca is a founder of the community bank, as well as the treasurer, and she likes that every time the loans grow her business. 

Her dreams are to grow her business and that her children will have professional careers.

loans.use: to buy basic necessity goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement and sand, and to hire workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy waterproofing materials.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es: El señor Carlos Arturo es una persona muy responsable con su trabajo que tiene desde hace 1 año, en una maquiladora desempeñando el oficio de operador. Hace ya mas de 3 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social, la cual necesita construir una barda al frente para que esta mejor protegida; de algún delincuente que quiera robar alguna pertenencia de Carlos que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha ido comprando. Para poder realizar su proyecto el necesita comprar material para iniciar la construcción y pagarle a la persona  mano de obra, todo para que el tenga mas tranquilidad al irse a su trabajo y dejar a su madre sin cuidado de que le pase algo.
texts.en: Mr. Carlos Arturo is a very responsible person who has been working for a year as a factory operator.  More than three years ago he acquired his subsidized house which is in need of a fence for greater protection against theft on the property that Carlos has worked hard to obtain.  In order to carry out his project he needs to buy material be begin construction and hire workers.  All of this is so he can go off to work and not have to worry about anything happening to his mother.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and rods, and to hire workers.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: El señor Héctor es un hombre muy trabajador que desde hace 14 años ha brindado su servicio para una maquiladora de la ciudad desempeñando lo mejor que el puede dar. Para Héctor le es muy importante iniciar un negocio en su vivienda para que lo atienda su esposa y por las tardes el, todo esto lo quiere hacer pensando en el futuro ya que algún día va a llegar a determinada edad que pueda ser pensionado por la empresa y asi el pueda dedicarse de lleno al negocio. El negocio que quiere comenzar es de abarrotes, por lo que quiere comprar refrescos, botanas, lácteos, comida en lata, galletas y mas, de esta manera el recibirá mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Mr. Héctor is a hard worker who has been an employee of a local factory for 14 years.  It is important for Héctor to start up a business in his home so his wife can attend to it in the afternoons.  He is thinking about the future when the company may retire him and he will then take over the business.  He wants to set up a grocery store and buy softdrinks, snacks, dairy products, canned goods, cookies and more items, so he can increase his income.

loans.use: To buy goods such as softdrinks, snacks and other items.

loans.name: Baterdene

texts.en: Baterdene is 31-years-old and lives with his wife in the Darhan-Uul province of Mongolia. Lender has his own well and plants his vegetable in his back yard. He started his business in 2009 by doing taxi service in the Darhan-Uul province. He has already gained recognition from his clients and customers. He is planning to upgrade his car due to the condition of his present car. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I have a plan to expand my business by participating in local transport tender." He is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to buy a new car for his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy a new car.

loans.name: Enhchimeg

texts.en:
Enhchimeg is 29-years-old and lives with her husband and a child in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Darhan-Uul province of Mongolia. Her husband is a construction worker and her daughter is in kindergarten. 

She started her garment business in 2010 by purchasing a counter in a local market for 450,000 MNT. Now her current assets are 800,000 MNT. Even though she is fairly new to the business, she has already gained recognition from her clients and customers. She is planning to expand her business in the future. 

She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I have a plan to expand my business and to increase my income." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase caftans and slippers.

loans.use: to purchase caftans and slippers.

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Ganchimeg is 28-years-old and lives with her mother, sister and daughter in an apartment in the Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her mother stays at home with her daughter and her sister works at the gas station. 

She operates a clothing sales business. She started her business in 1998 by renting a counter in a local market. Now she owns 2 counters in the market. She has gained a recognition from her clients and customers. She is planning to expand her business in the future and to repair her apartment. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I have a plan to expand my business by increasing my assets." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy construction materials to repair her apartment.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Battogtoh

texts.en:
Battogtoh is 33-years-old and lives with her children and a husband in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her children are in school and her husband helps with her business. She operates a grocery trading business. 

She started her business in 2007 by purchasing a counter in a local market. Her current assets are 8,000,000 MNT. She has gained a recognition from her clients and customers. She is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I have a plan to expand my business by increasing my assets." She is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to purchase grocery products from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products.

loans.name: Ma. Lovella

texts.en:
Ma. Lovella is 36 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Ma. Lovella runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store. She has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.
Ma. Lovella aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 54 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Magdalena runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her store.
Magdalena has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.
Magdalena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Hydie

texts.en:
Hydie is 47 years old and widowed with three children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for her children.
Hydie runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. Hydie has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as bread, biscuits, spices, canned goods, etc.
In the future, Hydie would like to save enough money to afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 27 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Genalyn runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 17,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for a year and also earns an income from pig fattening.
Genalyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 51 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Helen runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store. Helen has borrowed and paid back 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening and dealing in herbal medicine.
Helen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia works hard to support her family. She is single and has a house for rent business in the Philippines.
Emelia has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy materials for house improvement and repair. She has been in this business for five years now.
In the future, Emelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for house improvement or repair.

loans.name: Lagrimas

texts.en:
Lagrimas is 42 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.
Lagrimas has borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for nine years and also earns an income from rice farming and photography.
Lagrimas aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Margiolina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Margiolina works hard to support her family. She has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Margiolina is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her ready-to-wear business.
Margiolina has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Sweetie Pie

texts.en:
Our applicant is known as Sweetie Pie and, as her name implies, she is a lovable woman. She runs a sari-sari store, a community-based business that sells a variety of items in high demand in her area. Her husband is employed as a local agent for a distributing company based in their town. They have three children: Charmaine, 23 years old and a second-year nursing student; Hersal, 20 years old and a first-year college student; and Dennies Kae, 14 years old and a third-year high school student. They live in the village of Magsaysay, which is a few kilometers from the highway and near the local city hall. The village is known for rapid development and for its peaceful and orderly nature.

Her small store is open from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. Sweetie Pie decided to open her store because her husband's income is not large enough to support all the educational needs of their children.

Currently, Sweetie Pie is using her income to pay for the cost of having two children in college. She is seeking a loan to buy additional inventory for her store, including soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar, vinegar, canned foods and other items. By expanding her business, she will be able to help her husband to meet more of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, snacks and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 51 years old. She is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Violeta has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

Violeta has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 33 years old and is married with one child.

Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Delia has borrowed and paid for seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from farming rice, raising livestock and selling ready-to-wear.

Delia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Febe

texts.en:
Febe is 38 years old. She is married and has one child who is currently going to school. Febe works very hard to provide for her family.

Febe runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Febe has been in this business for two years. She sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, spices, noodles, eggs, etc.

In the future, Febe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 47 years old. She is married and has four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Annabelle is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pig.

Annabelle has been raising pigs for five years. She also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 47 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling beauty products in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more stock of beauty products to sell.
Merlie has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for six years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.
Merlie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Filomena has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for seven years. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Filomena has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Edlie

texts.en:
Edlie sells “halo-halo,” a snack that contains different fruits, such as banana, jack fruit, cassava, and coconut, and other flavorings, such as ice and milk. She has run this business for 26 years and it has helped her family to survive. She generates an income of 6,000 PHP from her business every month. 
Edlie dreams about expanding her business by acquiring additional capital of 10,000 PHP. She plans to buy more supplies for her business, such as glasses, spoons, containers and other materials that will be very helpful to her business. She anticipates a higher income with help from this loan from Kiva partner, ASKI.
Edlie is a 47-year-old woman. Her family lives in the village of Magsaysay, in the province of Isabela. Harley, her loving husband, is a well-known carpenter in their village. They still send their four children to school, which is the reason why the couple work hard. They hope to support all their children's educational needs so they can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy spoons and glasses for her business.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 72 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 
Dominga has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Dominga has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Marie Gay Rose

texts.en:
In a village where unity and cooperation are manifested through active participation during the yearly festival, you will find a sari-sari store (a community-based store) owned by Marie Gay. 
Marie Gay, 43, lives in the village of Magsaysay and is married to Perlito, who drives heavy equipment for a local construction firm. They are blessed with two children: Mary Anne – 16 years old and a sophomore in high school, and Merjohn Gayle – 7 years old.

Aside from having a sari-sari store (a common term for a small village store), Marie Gay also has a direct sales business. Being a hardworking businesswoman, Marie Gay works in her store, located next to her house, from 6am to 8pm. She sells a variety of products commonly used by villagers. Most of her products are canned goods, snack foods, bottled spices, perfumes, slippers, shoes and other items.
Marie Gay is requesting a loan so she can expand and improve her business. More stock will enable her to serve more customers to earn enough money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, drinks, perfumes and slippers for her store.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda, a 38-year-old married mother of two children, lives in the Philippines where she has had a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages for the past five years.  A new member of HSPFI, Rosalinda has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta, a 40-year-old married mother of two, lives in the Philippines where, for the past five years, she has been operating a retail shop that sells bananas and coconuts. A new member of HSPFI, Loreta has requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy more coconuts and bananas to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred, a 38-year-old store owner, is married to Serafin, a tricycle driver and manager of their welding shop as well as village treasurer. Their marriage is gifted with three children: Shermae Michelle – an 18-year-old first year nursing student; Sermil Micheal – a 15-year-old junior high school student, and Shella Mae – a 12-year-old Grade 6 elementary student. The family lives in Barangay Magsaysay Naguillan.

Mildred’s store has been a big help in their family, as each week she can earn a gross income of at least P 5000, budgeting that income to support the studies of her eldest, since the nursing course is very expensive, and the educational needs of her other two children. Some of the earnings are also used to maintain their corn and rice farming business.

To further sustain her store and farming business, Mildred is requesting a loan as additional capital with which she will buy more goods to offer in her store. The said amount will make her store profitable and hopefully enable her to convert it into a grocery store. In this way, she can provide for the immediate needs of the people in the community and spare them the inconvenience of having to go to the market for their basic requirements.

Through the income from her business, Mildred is able to provide the medication for her eldest child who is suffering from lupus, a chronic auto-immune disease that can be fatal. She prays that they can prevail in their struggle and that her child will be cured. She loves her family and becomes teary- eyed whenever she remembers her child's sickness. According to Mildred, her child is strongly fighting her sickness, and this gives her the strength to overcome it.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, drinks, and snack foods for her store.

loans.name: Kertha Bakti Group

texts.en:
The Kertha Bakti group is made up of 15 women who are neighbors in the same village in Melaya, West Bali. The group is seeking a loan of 22,500,000 Rupiah (IDR), and each member will receive 1,500,000 IDR. The group was formed out of these women's common interest in raising pigs to supplement family income, and out of their interest in receiving education on best practices for raising pigs. This is their fourth loan with MUK. 

Ni Luh is the head of the Kertha Bakti group. She is married and has three children. Her younger son is a toddler and her older son is in school. Her husband earns money as a farmer, but Ni Luh would like to help support her family with her pig raising business. She plans to sell the piglets after five months for others to fatten. With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
“I dream that my simple business today will improve so I can continue to help my husband in supporting our daily needs,” Nida Manuel of Magsaysay Naguillan, Isabela says.

She is married to Felimon, a carpenter, and their marriage is blessed with five children: Leni is the eldest, a 42-year-old high school graduate who is now in Hong Kong working as a domestic helper; Liza – a 36-year-old high school graduate; Roselene – a 33-year-old who is married and has finished high school; Binsor – a 32-year-old high school graduate who operates a tricycle, and Michael – a 27-year-old, and also a high school graduate.

Nida is currently engaged in food vending, every afternoon selling a variety of grilled foods such as barbecued pork, hotdogs, etc. She displays her products in front of their house. Nida wants to increase the quantity of the food she sells to earn more income and so is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 19,000 with which she will buy meats and other ingredients for her business.

“With such an amount, I hope to add other varieties of food for the hungry stomach. I am very optimistic that I will earn more to support my family's needs,” she says. In addition to her food-vending business, Nida also serves as the caretaker of a house owned by her nieces, who are abroad. This provides her with extra income.

loans.use: to buy drinks, bread, and meats for her business.

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita lives in the village of Magsaysay province of Isabela. She takes care of their two children.

She is engaged in the business of food vending. Aside from selling foods, Chita also sells clothes like shirts, skirts, pants, blankets, bed sheets, etc., to her fellow villagers. Sometimes, she also sells some of the products to her friends in the neighboring village.

Chita is currently in need of additional working capital to support her business. The loan will be used to purchase additional stock such as meat and spices. She also plans to buy her own motorcycle so that she can go to other villages to sell in a more convenient and faster way. She hopes that her business will prosper for the education of her children.

“I have a positive mindset that I can earn more income if I could add other varieties of clothes aside from what I have right now,” she said.

loans.use: to buy meat and spices for her business.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en:
Clotilde, 51 years old, is married and has two grown children. She has a retail shop where she sells different products in their community.

Clotilde is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy drinks, snack foods and spices for her store so she can more offer products to the people in the community. She hopes to gain more income to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snack foods and spices for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccine for her hogs.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 59 years old and sells generic medicines in her village. She has been a widow for about 18 years. Her husband passed when her youngest child was merely four years old. She has six children and is glad that some of them have their own good jobs that support their own families. Her youngest is now 22 years old and still lives with her. Josefina’s grandchildren inspire her every time she sees them and that keeps her working hard to expand her business. 

Josefina sells generic medicines in different villages near her place to generate a daily income to support her children's and grandchildren’s need. She is very proud that even though she is a widow, it has not been a hindrance for her to pursue working and provide financial support to her children. Josefina is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000, which will be used as her additional working capital in expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her business.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
