Миркыязу 59 лет, женат,вырастил 3 сына. Имея высшее образование, Миркыяз более 20 лет проработал в Распределительной Электростанции села Аксы диспетчером и известен как ответственный и целеустремленный человек. 
В 2009 году, в поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, которая увеличилась за счет внуков, Миркыяз решил начать выгодный для местного населения бизнес  в продаже чернослива.   Он сам собственноручно смастерил сушильный аппарат, в котором сушит сливу, закупленную у местного населения. Миркыяз трепетно и с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу, что позволило ему наработать более 5 тонн сухофруктов (чернослив).
Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Миркыяз обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на закупку сливы для сушки у местного населения.  С доходами от кредита, на следующий год он планирует расширить свой маленький бизнес.
texts.en: Mirkiyaz is 59 years old, married and raised three sons.  Having a higher education, Mirkiyaz spent over 20 years working as a dispatcher for the Distribution Power Plant in the Aksy village, and he is known as a responsible and goal-oriented person.  In order to find an additional source of income for his family that grew due to grandchildren, Mirkiyaz decided to start a business of selling dried plums in 2009.  This is considered to be a profitable business for the local residents.  Mirkiyaz treated his business carefully and with much responsibility, which allowed him to produce over 5 tons of dried fruits (dried plums).  In order to further expand his business, Mirkiyaz requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy plums for drying from the local residents.  He plans to use the profits from the loan to expand his small business.

loans.use: to purchase plums for drying

loans.name: Japaraly

texts.ru:
Жапаралы родился в городе Букара (Чуйская область, Кыргызская республика). Женат и воспитывает четверых детей. 
Жапаралы родился в простой и многодетной семье фермера. С детства Жапаралы помогал отцу по уходу за большим хозяйством, так как отец параллельно  работал водителем в местном колхозе, и поэтому ему нужна была помощь по уходу за скотом.
Окончив школу, Жапаралы отправляется служить в армию. В 1989 году, отслужив, Жапаралы женился и в этом же году поступил в торговый техникум. Отучившись два года, он устраивается на работу продавцом в универмаг, а затем в мясокомбинат охранником. В то время Жапаралы с женой жили с родителями. В 1993 году было решено отделиться от родителей и Жапаралы со своей семьёй переезжает в кошару родственников в село Сарго (Панфиловский  район, Кыргызстан). К тому времени у него уже было двое детей. Он ухаживал за скотом родственника, а так же приумножал свой скот в этой же кошаре, так как там были благоприятные условия для их содержания и разведения. Прожив в кошаре 6 лет и приумножив поголовье собственного скота, Жапаралы решает вернуться жить к родителям, так как он был младшим сыном, а по традициям кыргызов младший сын обязан ухаживать за престарелыми родителями. На тот момент у него уже было несколько дойных коров и телят. В 2009 году Жапаралы, распродав часть скота, купил однокомнатную квартиру в городе Карабалта.
 В данное время, благодаря предприимчивости и упорству Жапаралы в хозяйстве насчитывается 2 дойные коровы, 7 быков и 15 овец. Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Жапаралы обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. В бизнес - планах у Жапаралы -  увеличение своей фермы.
texts.en: Japaraly was born in the town of Bukara (Chuysk region, Kyrgyz Republic).  He is married and is raising four children.  Japaraly was born into a simple and large family of a farmer.  Since childhood, he helped his father to take care of a large farm, especially because his father also worked as a driver at the local collective farm and needed help to take care of livestock.  After graduating from school, Japaraly went to serve in the army.  In 1989, Japaraly got married after returning from the army and also started attending a retail college that same year.  He spent two years in college and then got a job as a salesperson at a department store, and then as a security guard at a meat processing plant.  At that time, Japaraly and his wife lived with the parents.  They decided to move out of the parents' home in 1993, and Japaraly and his family moved to their relatives' farm in the Sargo village (Panfilovsk district, Kyrgyzstan).  At that time, they already had two children.  Japaraly took care of his relatives' livestock and also increased the quantity of his own livestock at this same farm because it had suitable conditions for keeping and breeding livestock.  Having lived on this farm for six years and increasing the quantity of his own livestock, Japaraly decided to return to live with the parents because he was their youngest son.  According to Kyrgyz traditions, the youngest son has to take care of his aging parents.  At that time, he had several dairy cows and calves.  In 2009, having sold some of the livestock, Japaraly bought a one-bedroom apartment in the town of Karabalta.  Currently, thanks to his entrepreneurship and persistence, Japaraly has two dairy cows, seven bulls and fifteen sheep.  In order to further expand his business, Japaraly requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  Japaraly plans to expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. For the past ten years she has been managing a cereal shop to earn a living. She works hard in her business so as to provide for her family. In the next 5 years, she wants to manage a wholesale business. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 KES to buy a weighing machine. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loan to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy a weighing machine.

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.en:
Rose Mary is 38-years-old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 12 years, Rose Mary has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Rose Mary has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale, and will help Rose Mary to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Rose Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big bar. 

Rose Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher is 42 years old. He is married and has two children: a son and a daughter. Mher and his family live in Ijevan City. His son is studying at the Ijevan branch of Yerevan State University, and his daughter is attending school.  

Several years ago Mher worked as watchman at a Ijevan carpet manufacturer. Then he and his family moved to Russia where they lived and worked for about 7 years and in 2003 they returned to their native land. Now Mher works at wood-working shop as a master. 

Simultaneously with his work, Mher has run a clothes and shoes trading business since 2010. He and his wife buy clothes from Yerevan and resell them from their house at Ijevan city. They sell mens, women's and children’s clothes. Thanks to his occupation, Mher pays for his son’s education and supports his family. 

Mher is seeking a 700.000 AMD loan to buy autumn and winter clothes for his business. This is Mher’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy autumn and winter clothes for his business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is married and blessed with three children all of whom attend school. For the last three years, she has been managing a cereal shop to earn a living. Previously, she was doing farming. She has employed one person to help her to manage the business. In the next 5 years, she wants to become the supplier of cereals in her region. With 20,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy maize, beans and groundnuts for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and green grams (legumes).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a hardworking businessman aged 56. To support his family, he has been practicing dairy farming for the last eleven years. He also has a quarrying business to increase his income.  In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow. Since he decided to join Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a hardworking business woman aged 54. For over five years, she has been selling bananas to earn a living. Hannah has retained her business because of good reputation with her costumers. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya for training her on good customer care. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more bananas for resale.

loans.use: To buy bananas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is married and blessed with five children. For the last ten years, she has been practicing dairy farming to make a living.  She also does horticulture farming to earn extra income.  In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a father of 7 adult children. He is aged 61 and has been in farming for the last 15 years producing and selling carrots, cabbage, potatoes, and milk all of which are sold at the local market. He operates a retail shop for additional income.

Elijah has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase both a water tank and water pipes for an irrigation system. He says the loan will earn him income that will help improve his family's living standards. He adds that his focus is to purchase more land to expand his farming business. However, he is lamenting on the high cost of feeds.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and water pipes for an irrigation system

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is married and blessed with two children who are both in school. She has been selling clothing and timber for the last two years to earn a living. 

Alice has retained her business because of her good reputation among her customers.  In the next five years, she would like to open a boutique.  

Through her previous loans from Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save part of her income. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is 30 years old and married with one child who is in school. Her husband is a teacher. She runs a business selling charcoal in South Sudan, and she has been in this business for four years.

Cicilia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan so that she can order more charcoal to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fish wholesale to add to her current stock of fish.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is married and blessed with one child who is still in school.  For the last three years, she has been selling clothes and giving small loans to earn a living. Previously, she was doing farming. In the next 5 years, she wants to manage a boutique. 

Juliana is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shilling to buy clothes to sell. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save part of her income.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married and blessed with three children who are still in school.  For the last three years, she has been managing a retail shop and selling cereals to earn a living.  She is also employed as a teacher.  Joyce has employed two people to help her  manage her business.  In the next 5 years, she wants to establish a wholesale business. 

Joyce is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat and beans to resell. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: buy sugar, cooking fat and beans

loans.name: Affa

texts.en:
Affa is 25 years old.  She is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school.  Her husband is a carpenter.  Affa has a business selling ice cream in South Sudan.  She has been in this business for five years.

Affa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase ice cream to sell.  She says that she will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: buy ice cream

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is married and blessed with two children, both of whom attend school.  He has been practicing dairy farming for the last seven years to earn a living.  In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business.  Joseph desires to become more financially stable in future. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy animal feed. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: buy animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She has been running a tailor shop for the last two years to earn a living. She has employed two people to help her manage the business. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. 

Monica is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fabrics and a sewing machine for her business. Thanks to to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to boost her business with the previous loan.

loans.use: buy fabrics and a sewing machine

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man. For the last eleven years, he has been selling cows to make a living. He has retained his business because of the good reputation with his customers.  Daniel has employed one person to help him to manage the business.  In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. 

Daniel is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a young heifer for resale. He expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer care.

loans.use: buy a heifer

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 35-year-old hardworking business woman. She is married and blessed with three children who are still in school. For the last three years, she has been managing a beauty shop to support her family. In the next 5 years, she wants to establish a wholesale business. 

Since Nancy decided to join Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save part of her income. This has helped her manage her finances. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy braids, perfumes and cosmetics for resale.

loans.use: To buy braids, perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Yunis

texts.en:
Yunis is 40 years old.  She has four children, all of whom are in school.  She is a widow.  Yunis has a business of selling alcohol in South Sudan.  She has been in this business for six years.

Yunis requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase alcohol for sale.  She says that she will use the extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: buy alcohol to resell
